description: Toad Hall is one of the larger gay bars in the Castro.  I like to come here for the large patio.  Crowd is mixed.  They have 2 bars.  Dance floor is huge.  Drinks are strong and they offer happy hour most nights.  Large mens bathroom outside. Karaoke Sunday and Tuesday.
author: Alan H.

description:
Music and dancing on point. Bartenders are not.
Happy hour special advertised until 9pm, 2 for 1 special +$1. I came up for the second time that night and ordered my drinks. Bartender charged me full price. I went back to get my wallet and also peeked at my phone. Showed him it was 8:59 and said "it's still happy hour, yay!" he goes "no, it's over..." and I show him my phone again, to which he again says "no, it's over" really rudely. I paid full price, said thank you and continued on with my night. Rude.
author: Bella S.

description:
I went there with my friends for pride and I didn't know you not suppose to tip your change to the bartenders and one of their bartenders told me that it was very rude of me to give him my change that a good tips is in bills . What a sad problem they have and I know they won't care that I don't not come back there ever again but I hope management do something about that . I think is just very stupid .
A tip is a tip , still money right ?
author: Rosario H.

description:
Toad Hall is definitely my favorite bar/dancing spot in the city. Close behind is Temple, but Toad Hall beats it for a couple reasons.

1. You will never find cheaper drinks. They have $5 well cocktails, and when I say cocktails I mean a cup full of liquor with a splash of mixer. They do not taste good, but they do the job.

2. The music is really fun (90s/throwbacks + newer dance music + music to sing along to), and they play music videos which is a cool addition. 

3. I rarely feel like it's too crowded. The dance floor isn't big, but there's usually enough space to dance without getting annoyed.

Notes:
- if you're a girl this place is great because it's a gay bar, so you won't have to deal w guys hitting on/touching you
- if you're a guy you may have to deal w guys hitting on/touching you if you don't come with a group of girls. If you come w a couple girls you should be good.
author: Elena K.

description: This place is racist. I'm Asian and because I get red the bouncer thought I was too fucked up to go in.
author: Brian P.

description:
Toad Hall is my favorite bar in the city, hands down! Fun music to dance to and cheap drinks...how could it be better??

The heavy pours and low cost make it the easiest place to get drunk in the city and I'm never disappointed. 

Only thing is I wish they accepted credit cards. It's a hassle to get cash before going but it's well worth it.
author: Nick D.

description: Watered down vodka - their two for one specials with vodka are clearly watered down I would avoid this place or choose non clear spirits they are clearly taking advantage of patrons and an inspection by the regulators is due.
author: Bert K.

description: I like this place.  Drinks were good and not super expensive. Pretty fun and casual. Good music too. Had a blast here.
author: Nancy S.

description:
Good drinks
Good vibes
Nice staff
Really had a good time!
Drinks are on the cheap end and delicious
author: Joe D.

description:
It was my first time here, inwak d to the bartender and I asked for a drink, asking him what do you offer? His respond was!!!!
Have u ever been in a bar ???!!! He was such an asshole person ever meet I have  been in a bar around the world, ugly Steve. 
I really want to be in contact with their manager to tell him to teach them how behave and welcomes other 
I hated this bar
author: Mehran M.

description: Sad it always smell like cigarette. Great bartenders and crowd, but the open door between the patio and the bar makes you not want to come back, especially if you're not a smoker.
author: Carlos G.

description:
The former Pendulum is now Toad Hall.  Despite the odd name, we had lots of fun here where we ended our night of bar hopping.

ATMOSPHERE:
The place has been totally remodeled.  It's now airier and brighter, and sports a good sized dance floor, big bar, a few high tops, and a small back room which I peeked into.  It's the most "clubby" vibe I've experienced in the Castro so far, better than Badlands IMO.  The room was also perfectly lit, not dark and shady like at other places.  The crowd was a mix of ages and personalities, dancing to a blend of pop, dance, and R&B.

SERVICE:
We sat at the bar and received fast and friendly service from the male bartender.  He kept the bar top clean and drinks flowing.  Beer prices were average.

OVERALL:
Nice new digs, friendly staff and patrons, great place to dance.
author: Vince N.

description: Came here late on a Sunday night (Labor Day weekend) with friends. I got their current special, strawberry vodka with 7-Up which was really good (and strong) for only $6! We all had a great time dancing and I loved the mix of music that they played. It's a fun vibe and definitely a great value. They have plenty of seating too if you're not into dancing.
author: Pooja C.

description: You can tell they smoke here when they close.  I'm fine with people smoking - but not when I'm choked out.  It's that super, duper lingering smoke;  Like your old nasty aunt's house w that weird thing in her throat.  Two thumbs Down!!
author: Janet J.

description: It was a fairly busy Thursday night. My date and I stood at the bar for a good minute trying to order a drink. The bartender acknowledged us saying we were next but then kept floating around helping everybody else. All we wanted were a couple of draft beers. After he helped about 4 other parties ahead of us we decided to just leave and go to another bar.
author: Vivian P.

description: Read the reviews almost no one has posted a positive review of this place in a while. Used to be a fun local dive bar with cheap two for one drinks, cool bartenders, decent music and a fun chill crowd.  They have since cut back their happy hour to before 6 on weekends, the chairs/tables are falling apart, and the owner purchased the old Patio bar redecorated it and has been letting it sit empty for years.  Go to the mix!
author: William O.

description: Came here for a quick drink last night and loved it. I was the only female inside but everyone was super welcoming, the music was awesome and the drinks were good (drinks are on the strong side - yay!).
author: Mira B.

description: Great service, great dancing, great space. Good if you wanna hang around and chill or if you wanna dance some in a fun environment.
author: David M.

description:
Cheap vodka bar located in the Castro.  They advertise $5 vodka based drinks, and have their bar shelves filled with vodkas.

I came at an early time with friends, so it wasn't crowded. It felt like the typical bar setting with tvs on the screen and had a mini dance floor.
author: Jacky C.

description:
was in the neighborhood at a friend's house. After dinner and lots of laughter we walked over to Toad Hall..... I've been to a couple of gay bars on Market and one thing --- the most important thing --- they seem to get right is the music! boy oh boy! Great music, good transition and not super crowded...... we danced until it was 1:45am, lights turned on and they forced us to leave! 

didn't try any cocktails, went straight for the shots ;-)

so. much. fun.
author: Kinjal S.

description: Outside of the obnoxious old weird people here it's kinda cool.  Good strong drinks.  Nice bar tender.  Good at peace making.
author: MImi M.

description: My partner had his phone lifted and then we found the guy using it. Don't take your valuables in. Keep your stuff in your front pockets and be alert not flattered!
author: Thom H.

description: Two for one happy hour!!! Oh so dangerously fun! Love the space and room to dance your lil behinds off.
author: Catherine K.

description:
Normally I don't like to write bad reviews but I am still appalled by this particular interaction days later. 

I came here the Saturday night before Halloween, and went up to the bar to ask for a water cup. It was towards the end of the night and not crazy busy. The bartender (dark hair, had a moon tattoo I think) 
told me to pick up one of the water cups that had been sitting there... "that's why they're there" he said. I asked for a new one and explained those had been sitting there. In retrospect he may have thought I was implying they were warm, but his whole attitude sucked and he made it seem SO inconvenient. Sorry I don't want to take a chance on roofied water?? 

He was working within 5+ feet of those waters at any given time and they were well within reach to anyone. Women are consistently taught not to take drinks we haven't seen poured or leave drinks unattended. I will gladly and patiently wait my turn for a water I know is safe AND I actually tip a buck or two on water cups.
author: Shelby S.

description:
Great place to get happy hour drinks. We randomly came in here and found out their happy hour was 2 for 1. The bartender said they were trying something new and didn't know the set time so maybe this is new?

My boyfriend and I ordered a Moscow Mule and it was great for its price!

In regards to the atmosphere, they play more old school music here that's not my taste, but this is a great place to get some drinks!
author: Aj C.

description:
Perfectly average dance bar that, no matter the crowds, generally has enough room to spread out both inside and in the rear patio. If you ignore any weekend cover charges, the drinks aren't terribly priced, and the crowd here is more mellow and less self-absorbed than at other neighborhood establishments. The music is generally OK too.

Overall, there's nothing terribly special about this place, but it might be worth a stop if you're doing a crawl through the neighborhood.
author: Vincent L.

description: Bartenders are nice, good drinks, and they play great music. Went for a birthday, and we had a lot of fun. I would go back again.
author: Andrew M.

description:
After getting out of Rifftrax Live, my friend who lives in the Castro said walk to Toad Hall. Sure, and thank you Google Maps.

First thing I noticed was there was no bouncer carding. Maybe the Castro is more laid back like that? But ran into my friend and some of his friends in the main bar area - typical layout with bar on one side, a counter by the windows, some booths on the far wall from the bar, and a large open area for dancing in between, with TVs playing music videos everywhere. 

Not sure if it's like this every night, but they had $3 well drinks. My friend joked how it was like cheap drinking in college again. It definitely tasted cheap and mistake-y, just like college. The drink was vile, but you get what you pay for. Seriously, pay the extra $3 for Jack or just power through.

There is also an outdoor patio with its own bar, but that bar closes a bit early. Plenty of heat lamps outside. In either area it wasn't cramped.

Some observations
-everyone knows everyone else
-casual, positive vibe in both rooms. Considering the view from just walking past the Badlands, I'm glad my friend picked here.
-I didn't realize how hardcore the drag queen scene is. I know, Castro, Duh! But it's another thing to have an Empress hopeful come in with fliers, fans, and stickers. To Deena Cartier, Imperial Crown Princess to the 22nd reign, Imperial Star Empire of Alameda - you have my vote.
-Trying to explain Rifftrax and Mystery Science Theater 3000 was more difficult than powering through the cheap drink.
author: Michael C.

description:
Came here with some gay friends for some drinks and to see what the queer scene is all about here.  (disclaimer: I'm straight)

Parking is available on the street.

Cover is only $2.

Even though this place is a gay bar, I'd say easily 20-30% of the people were straight couples.

There is a patio area in the back that is covered, but is technically outdoors.

The music volume was quite good, as was the music mix.  The dance area is decent sized but it was pretty full.  We ended up sitting on the side, where it is less cramped.  There are plenty of mirrors lining the walls, which make the place look a bit larger.

The Long Island iced tea I had was $5.50, which is decent for a nightclub.
author: Edward L.

description: Good happy hour deals and pretty neat hang out spot.  The lady bartender that usually works the patio bar is really nice!
author: Chelsea D.

description: Nice place to come for happy hours with your friends. Nice little outdoor area to hang out. Happy that they have two restrooms now. Music is good. Pretty divey place to come.
author: Daisy M.

description: OH MY 2 FOR 1! Leave it to The Castro to know how to turn up. Drinks here are 2 for 1 during happy hour (which lasts a cool 3+ hours). They literally give you both drinks at once. Came here with coworkers one night after work and had way too much fun...so much that we paid for it the next day. Minus a few stars because it's pretty divey and could use some work to keep it clean and up-to-date, but something tells me regulars find it charming.
author: Mandy A.

description: My first foray into The Castro district was awesome bc this place has good music and decent drinks! Loved it!
author: Nancy K.

description:
I got my phone stolen here. Its super shady, and they crowd is rough. 

Other than that, the drinks are CHEAP ($5 for a Long Island). The music was great, (stereotypical gay bar music aka Britney and Ke$ha). And the atmosphere was pretty fun in the front area. 

The back porch area though, thats some real talk creepy crowd of seedy looking individuals who may or may not steal your phone.
author: Molly S.

description: Absolutely Love this bar!!!! It is so cute and they always  play a good mix of music!! The outside bar and smoking area make it so fun just to enjoy a casual night out on the Castro!!! They always have great Kareeokee and it can get packed tight for a good club night!! All around best bar in the castro..
author: Maya G.

description:
Dark Latino bartender with the black curly pony tail purposefully ignored me and my friend when we tried to order drinks at the bar. It was not like the bar was slammed either... (It was a Sunday night at 10:30 pm and at most there were 2-3 people coming up to the bar for drinks). It got so awkward that we had to leave the bar as we couldn't order any drinks. I come here all of the time with my girlfriends, but will go to Badlands instead from now on...

 I hope the owner knows that he just lost some business because his bartender was having a "bad day".
author: Barbara A.

description:
im giving this place 4 stars b/c I had an amazingly great time!
Despite of the weather, it was our first night in SF, so might as well go ALL out!
It was me and my "mean girl crew" (four of us total) 
One of my friend's, he's originally from the bay and always partied in the castro.  So he took us here.  
From what I remembered, it was packed and drinks were stiff.  It didn't matter to me, I was already intoxicated, haha!
I met 2 cool new instagram friends! 

I guess everywhere in the castro is CASH ONLY! which kind of sucks! 

Friday night was a blast!
author: Remie M.

description: Staff is incredibly rude. I was out with a couple of friends and on our last round of drinks, the bar staff neglected to inform us that in 5 minutes they would kick us out of the bar because they were closed. The sale of liquor in San Francisco ends at 2am, however, there is no legislation that states liquor sold prior to 2am cannot be consumed past the sale of liquor. Terribly run business and rude employees.
author: Cameron A.

description: Went here last night with 3 friends. The guys at the door were super nice, it was $3 to get in and the drinks were reasonably priced and strong! The music was great the entire night and we danced until we were soaked. They have a great outdoor area out back but I preferred the inside. The bartender could of been nicer and it was hot inside but overall it was a great time out. Definitely will be back in the future.
author: Nicole N.

description:
We came here to watch the 49ers game.  I was surprised to find it crowded.   There are lots of tv's on the walls, so watching the game was not hard. Too bad the 49ers lost, but it was good to be with a cheerful crowd.  

The bartenders are fast and friendly.   I need to remember to come here on Sunday again. It would probably be good leisurely place to hang out at.
author: Marck N.

description:
I've been to the bar before last night but, when I tell you what I witnessed; you wouldn't believe it! 
1st situation: a guy bumped an employee out in the back patio drunken and rather carelessly. I walked out and witnessed the employee very angry and yelling at the patrons.. He literally wanted to fight. I wouldn't have known he was even an employee had he not been in work attire. The customer's friends were trying to calm him down and he was just yelling at them. I wanted to locate his manger. If you don't have the patience to deal with people and liquor AND crowds then why even apply for the job.

2nd situation: after witnessing the craziness outside, I figured I'd give the bar another shot before simply leaving. I walk up to the bar and these two women are ordering from a bartender. I'm not sure what was the issue between them and the bartender but to walk up and witness the bartender pour a full drink out and tell the customer "there's your drink B!*CH" I was in shock. The girls asked me if I witnessed it and they even snapped a pic of him. I couldn't respond; I just left and ordered at the other side of the bar.

Seriously what is up with the customer service at this place?? It's very very rare to get treated like crap where you spend your money.
author: Keyon I.

description: Decided to stop in here from the sweltering heat after brunch in the Castro with my friends Selino and Kanako. They had a 2 for 1 happy hour special and we sat at barside. Kanako had a house wine and Selino and I ordered vodka tonics. It was nice and cool inside and definitely had a great time catching up.
author: Mika D.

description: 241 happy hour.... 5 stars!!
author: Jan R.

description: Toad Hall is a great place to go and hang with friends. The music and back patio are great. Simon is an AWESOME bartender that makes really good drinks and is always super friendly and efficient. Ps, the pineapple Moscow mule is delish. Toad Hall is a great place to have a great time with good friends as well as make new friends in the community.
author: Wyatt B.

description:
Their 2 for one are the best. It's always a pleasure coming here when visiting SF. It just has a good vibe. It was an outside patio so you can chill out there if you don't mind chillen with the smokers lol. 

There's just one that really REALLY bugs me about this place and that's not having any mirrors in their bathroom!!! Haha I know it's lame but damn, how you not have a mirror? Mothafuckas do wanna check themselves out here and there. Geeez! But whatever, it's not much of a deal breaker for me. It's coo, I guess. :)

Oh and bring cash, that's all they take. They do have an ATM machine in there though. 

Other than that, enjoy their HH - two for one drinks. Come here when ya thirsty! Lol
author: Ardie M.

description: Normally a fan of toad hall, but today while there, the patio bar restroom smelled horribly of stale beer and even more stale urine!  :(  PowerWash please!!!
author: Pauly E.

description:
Recently spent a Saturday night out here with a friend and we had a blast. $2 cover fee isn't bad so no complaints there and we didn't have to wait in the line to get it so that was nice! 

We were drinking cocktails all night that were pretty averagely priced. But the best part of this place is the dance floor! They play the best music from all the best current pop hits to classics like Madonna and Whitney Houston. We were dancing for three straight hours I swear! Everyone is having a blast on the dance floor and you just feel comfortable to let loose! I came here on a friends suggestion and without a doubt I will be back next time I'm out in the Castro.
author: Mandy A.

description: I heard of Toad Hall for the first time because my friend told me they were having viewing parties of RuPaul's Drag Race. I have not been to one BUT my friends brought me here after we got bored of the music at Badlands one Friday night. Toad Hall is much more laid back and chill. The music is not too crazy, and if you find yourself wanting to tone it down even more, there's the outdoor patio at the back of Toad Hall. Similar to Badlands, the drink specials are very inexpensive. It's just less crowded, which translates to... I like this place!
author: Stefanie C.

description: It's a good place to start off the night when out with friends for a night of drinking. I generally try to stay inside because the back patio is full of smokers. Be ready to inhale endless smoke from cigarettes smokers. The dance floor is tiny but it works. Like I said, it's a good place to start off before heading somewhere else to dance or finish off the night.
author: Andrew S.

description: My favorite part of Toad Hall is their patio! its a great place to meet old and new friends and the inside has a nice size dance floor as well. The drinks are always strong and cheap and the bartenders are friendly.
author: Garrett A.

description:
$2.50 well drinks? YES.

Music videos that accompany the song that is actually playing? YES.

I love the Castro.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Second time here. These guys are putting cheap booze in call bottle. First Bulliet, now Sky. It's illegal you cheap bastards!
author: Jerry V.

description:
Another fun-filled Friday night in San Francisco with my co-workers, who have quickly morphed into my drinking buddies. 

We got to Toad Hall at around 11:30, and the place was hoppin'. There was a $2 cover charge, which was kind of a bummer, but the drinks were pretty cheap, so I can't complain too much. A DJ was spinning some awesome dance music, and there were TVs playing the accompanying music video of whichever song was playing. 

I met some lovely people. There are so many friendly folks. Granted, bars in the Castro tend to have some of the sweetest, most genuine human beings.

I did not felt weird or creeped out here, except maybe when I went in the bathroom and some guy was peeing with the door wide open. I get it, unisex toilets are the best option, but I really wish people would lock the door behind them.  

Be warned: the bouncer may check the inside of your purse or backpack, so make sure you leave your assorted party favors at home.
author: Brandi W.

description:
This was the second place that we went to for my BFF's birthday night out. I've been here one time before this last time. I feel like this is one of the more chill bars in the Castro. 

I enjoy the atmosphere, a little more chill than the other spots in the Castro. They still have good music and a dance floor for people to get down on. My feet were killing me because I made the mistake of wearing heels. So I was pretty happy when I was able to sit down while my friends danced their little hearts out.

If I had a choose a place to go to in the Castro, I'd probably choose this place first.
author: Rachel S.

description: Let me begin by saying that I have been to this bar many times since I have lived in SF, and have always had a wonderful experience. However, tonight was different. Tonight I was treated very disrespectfully by the staff, and neither I nor my friends will ever by giving this bar our business in the future. About a half hour ago, I went to meet my friends, showed my ID to a man named Toby (or Tony) working the line, and then went to pay the cover. When I realized I didn't have enough cash, I texted my friends who were inside to come out to spot me for the cover. The man working the cash register politely told me where I could find an ATM close by. Toby curtly asked me to step aside while I waited for my friends, which is fair. I stood on the sidewalk for a few moments while waiting for my friend, when he asked me with a very rude tone to move over so I wasn't blocking the sidewalk. I waited, and my friend came out and gave me the two dollars I needed. I hopped back in line, and offered the men my cash, at which point "Toby" told me I could not go inside, because I was "too intoxicated." I informed him that I was not intoxicated, and he responded by mocking my body language, which is completely inappropriate and culturally insensitive, and telling me that it didn't matter what I said or did, I wasn't going to be let into the bar. I am a woman in my mid 20s, I had three drinks throughout the night, beginning at 7:30pm. It was 1:00am when I was going into the bar (I am writing this a half hour later). I was obviously not intoxicated. Certainly less intoxicated than most of the other people in line for the bar. I tried to reason with "Toby" seeking an explanation as to why I was not being allowed into the bar, as a patron who has given that bar my services for several years. Instead of treating me with respect and having a reasoned conversation with me, he threatened to call "Castro Patrol" and forced me to leave the premises. I have never been treated with such disrespect in my life, and I will be contacting Toad Hall to ensure that the manager knows his rude bouncer has cost the bar a lifelong patron. I am very disappointed, and feel that I was discriminated against as a woman, particularly when "Toby" mocked my body language, which was extremely offensive and unprofessional. When I politely asked why I wasn't being allowed in, and what I could do differently in the future, he told me to "look less drunk." Obviously the person writing this review is not "drunk." He had the nerve to say that to my face as I stood in front of him calmly asking him what the problem was, and what I could do differently. Needless to say, I will never be returning to Toad Hall. I have never been subjected to this kind of treatment in my life. I have never been mocked in this way in my life. And as an influential professional woman in SF I will make sure my friends and social circles choose other bars in the area. Your loss, Toad Hall. I suggest you reconsider your employees.
author: Alex D.

description: Watered down drinks and the music isn't that great either.  The only reason I would come back is for the hot bartenders!
author: Josh S.

description: Got my phone stolen here, after receiving a flyer at the entry that said protect your belongings.... A little sketch. There are way better bars for drinks and dancing at the Castro.
author: Payje R.

description: Came to karaoke tonight and saw it was packed. I expected an overworked guy being rude to me as I put in my song, instead I got a great guy who let me know it'd be about 8 songs. The bartender  was so freaking great his name is Kyle, he was suuuuupppppeerrr busy but he not only managed the situation but he remembered my drink from like 30 minutes ago. Give him a raise
author: Jason E.

description:
Love this place, went for the first time last night. 

A. Great music
B. Great people
C. Clean
D. Inexpensive
author: Nicole A.

description: Great music, something for everyone from Britney (not a fan), to Beyonce and now Luther Vandross is playing!!! Jeremiah the bartender is awesome and while the drink specials are great they aren't as bad ass as he is.
author: Tearene H.

description:
2-for-1 drinks until 9pm?  Want to drink on the cheap?  Head to the Castro. 

When you're so used to spending $10+ for a specialty cocktail, it's downright amazing to learn that $19.50 can buy six (six!) drinks, and strong ones too.  Sure they may not be the best you've had, but sometimes quantity is preferred over quality.  And Toad Hall does this well, with fun music and a chill crowd to boot.
author: Joanne G.

description:
Toad hall itself is usually wonderful - my favorite bar in the Castro - large outdoor patio, less intense crowd than badlands, great music, friendly bartenders, and cheap drinks.

Last night though, one of the guys on staff who clears empty glasses - white, 30-ish, brown hair - started hitting on me as I was waiting for a friend to come out of the bathroom. When I made it clear that I wasn't interested (taken), he got irate and accused me of being vomit-level drunk - suggesting that he would have me thrown out. I was dumbfounded at his insane abuse of power / sexual harassment,  but he left me alone when I asked to speak to someone else on staff. Later on as I was dancing with my friends, he walked out of his way so he could elbow me. Wicked petty.  

Don't try to punish guys for not being into you, you insecure douchebag.
author: Vincent L.

description:
Went there about a week ago....it's definitely more of a bar than a place for dancing, even though there's a dancefloor. The music is horrible (same electro remix beats all night long) , but the drinks are okay. Big patio in the back. No cover before a certain time (usually like 9pm-ish), and even then it's cheap.

However I almost had to put the bartender in check; first a couple kept walking past me and my friend (probably because they didn't think we were "cute enough"), and then the one who did finally help us still didn't look pleased to serve us. Well, F you too dude. You wish you were all that but you're not. I really should have gotten his name. 

There was the happy hour special still going on, get 1 drink and the other one is only like a $1, so I ordered two strawberry cosmos. And the bartender stupidly asks "One or two sets?" I didn't understand what he meant at first so I just repeated myself with "No, 2 strawberry cosmos please" and he rudely ROLLED HIS EYES at me and was like "Yeah, but do you want 1 or two sets??" with a snobby attitude. Um HELLO?? Do you see four people standing in front of you? When I first made the order I pointed to me and my friend next to me, the ONLY TWO GUYS in front of you, and I said TWO  COSMOS. NOT TWO SETS OF COSMOS. 

So of course I only tipped him one lousy dollar, and I made sure to stand there at the same spot and wait for him to be even more disappointed when he picked it up. I don't know what's up with the snobby SF bars I've been having to deal with lately.
Here's the thing, it wouldn't even have been much of a big deal if he didn't have such a messed up attitude while talking to me. It wasn't even that busy to be annoyed with customers so early on; if you don't like the bar scene take your shallow conceited behind out into the world and get a real job then.
author: Marquis A.

description:
Strong drinks.
Personable bartenders.
Mellow vibe.
Wished they closed the door to the smoking area--phew--it stunk up the bar with a persistent, mild (yet acrid) dose of second hand carcinogens. 
.
author: Thomas D.

description:
it was a lonely and quiet Labor day night at this joint.  Across the way where The Edge was having Musical videos playing, this bar was like a toad stuck in the middle of the pond during lightning season.

Empty no, but very few patrons on a holiday evening and of course, a bartender that is focused on talking to his regulars than noticing a person waiting for a drink in the middle of the bar.

I gave it three stars because it was quiet and clean and a good respite from the other bars I had hopped from in the Castro area.  I guess normally this place would be full of young and old gay men and women dancing to the music (I noticed a dj booth in the corner).  

Not a big space but its serviceable if other bars are busy such as Badlands where the dancing is more prevalent.

Maybe next time it will b busier and the bartender will be busy with other customers other than his friends or the regulars.
author: Melanio F.

description:
Apparently this is not a very friendly place! My daughter has a hip problem and had to sit down to rest after walking a distance, which may be a block or more.  The  MANAGER, of all people pushed her violently to move her away. How can this happen, this should not be allowed to happen! This is a public place of service after all. 
I'm very upset about this kind of behavior! Especially coming from a "professional" bar keep.
I would appreciate a response from any employee, owner, or MANAGER!
author: Rose C.

description: really cheap drinks at happy hour. Like, really cheap.  We had 6 drinks (4 long islands and some 2 flavored vodka cocktails) and the total came in under 20 bucks.  Upbeat music, good people watching, and cheap booze.  Good times.
author: Jon Q.

description: This place has gone down hill.  Our last visit was Sunday, June 28th.  The whole bar smelled like sewer inside, especially strong walking past the restrooms to the patio, just unacceptable.  The service was slow and it wasn't busy.  Not the place to go anymore.
author: Brian H.

description:
I have been coming to this place since I've been of age to drink and  I have had more good times then I can count but, It's never occurred to me to write a review until today... When I got the worst service I've ever gotten at a bar.  ESPECiALLY at a gay bar. In the midst of Sunday drinking with friends we wondered over to Toad Hall around 4pm because we all remembered having these amazing Baileys jello pudding shots. To our disappointment they weren't available so we had to come up with some other options to continue tying on a tight one. I approached the bar and noticed some signage for a bottle of champagne for $15 and thought it would be nice just to buy a bottle for my friends and myself.  So, (because it was ridiculously cheap and I knew it was not likely to be a #1 option I asked the bartender what kind of champagne) he immediately snapped back with "I don't know it's cheap. There's a line" ummm excuse the fuck out of me but you are in the service industry dude! And I did not say any of the following: "is that $15 champagne as cheap as the Tijuana facelift you evidently had.. Because they missed your turkey gobble"  "Is that $15 champagne as aged as you are"  "which is a bigger joke that $15 champagne or the fact that you're 60 and in a muscle tee?"  Immaterial superficialities aside.. I knew that  I was not getting a bottle of Krug or Tattinger or fucking Cristal but this is San Francisco.  Sue me because I ambitiously and evidently very stupidly hoped to pay a 400% markup for possible bottle of trader joes  featured cremant. I was elated at the prospect actually.. And my  
elation turned to intrigue And God forbid my intrigue turn into an inquiry. I am a bartender as well and I would be told to leave immediately if  my boss heard me speak to a guest that way and as well I should. In conclusion I surmise that the amazing times had at this bar were due to the company I kept. Maybe the service was good before and maybe not so good but it fell to the background and allowed me to enjoy the experience I was having with my friends where as this experience in particular, drew all of my attention to the fact that I was being spoken to an unthinkable manner in the context of "service" I hope the bartender puts the 50 cent tip I left him towards a shirt with sleeves.
author: Ryan J.

description:
This was the first gay bar we stopped at in San Fran and we all had a blast. The place isn't huge, but definitely big enough to boogie with your friends. The music was great (mainstream pop) to dance to and the people were very friendly. Drinks weren't expensive either. I think I may have paid less than $6 for a long island! We went on a Wednesday night so it wasn't overly crowded and it was just a perfect amount of people. No cover!

FYI - They only accept cash.
author: Aj S.

description: Your daytime crowd would be better if the ''regular'' who is a miserable gristle of a man would go away! Also, the bartender is under the impression that people are there for him, and not the other way around, I make this observation based on the fact that he prefers people that chase away good business and real tippers and embraces entitled, unfriendly and caustic real estate agent that should have a house fall on her! Name a canoe Joe and it won't tip!
author: Chas A.

description:
The reason this place is getting 4 stars is because it's cash only(its does have an ATM inside the bar but the excessive fees are awful) AND because they don't(or at least not with us) take requests for songs or music videos. 

Other than the above, Toad Hall Bar is beyond FUN! They have an excellent happy hour and everyone there(bar patrons as well as bar tenders) were fun and happy and just enjoying the night. I love going to a place that is unpretentious and where people were NICE to each other. No matter if you knew them or not. 

This is probably just me but be fore warned that the bathrooms are co-ed but everyone is very respectable.

All in all we had a great time dancing, singing and drinking the night away!
author: Whitney S.

description: Nice place to chill. Across the way at Badlands is always way too crowded sometimes. At Toadhall it seems to be a little more relaxed. But this place does get busy on the weekends.
author: Kenson K.

description:
Big Bar. 
Great Drink Specials. 
Huge Dance Floor. 
Outdoor Patio with Heating. 
Fun Music. 
Security At The Door. 

--- Yay!
author: Kate D.

description:
I can't stress enough how much I enjoy double-fisting. 2 for 1 drinks til 9pm everyday. I hadn't been here in a while (years) and spend New Years Day here with old friends. Still the same ol' Toads Hall...BUT they have karaoke now ^_^

Um! As if double-fisting and watching Beyonce music videos wasn't good enough, now you get to belligerently howl out the words to Selena Gomez's "Love you like a love song" - YESSSSSS. 

I've always had fun here, if I'm wasted and twerkin' to myself in front of a mirror or in the patio under the heat lamps, conversing loudly.
author: Lydia L.

description:
I'm not sure how Toad Hall got it's name but it's up-n-coming in the Castro nightlife scene.  This bar is pretty open and always plays decent music.  the bartenders from Badlands frequent this spot as they are both owned by one person.  If you smoke or don't mind the smell you can check out the back covered patio area with a bar so that you're not dealing with the overcrowded entryway. 

The stage on the dance floor is only for the brave and/or drunk but it makes it a little easier for everyone else in the bar to watch and laugh as people bump and grind. The music videos are great so check out lady Gaga whenever her videos play or Lady Tatas on her premiers.
author: Kevin J.

description:
A happy place even if you're straight if you like dancing to silly music videos.

Cheap drinks.

Tuesday night karaoke.
author: Inigo M.

description:
Never have I ever...had a bad time here! The crowd is always decent, the bartenders (same as Badlands across the street) are always so nice and know how to a pour a good strong drink. 

Head straight to the back patio. It's heated, there's a second bar out there and the better looking crowds of people usually congregate there.
author: Chris W.

description: DONT GO HERE. You think the dance scene is great until the paper handout warnings at the door come true and all your shit is stolen. You should be able to trust your community more than getting your shit stolen
author: Kelly G.

description:
First star: Happy hour lasts until 8:30 p.m. Hell, that's almost 9 o'clock!

Second star: Two-for-one happy hour vodka cocktails...TWO-FOR-ONE!

Third star: These two-for-ones are not wimpy two-for-ones. These two-for-ones are hard-core two-for-ones and you can score these hard-core two-for-ones for as low $4.50. Two strong drinks, $4.50! Until 8:30!

Fourth star: Super-nice, smiley bartender who gave me a glass filled with Gummi Bears. I looked up and down the bar and he hadn't given them to anyone else...just ME. *swoon*

Did I mention they have two-for-ones until 8:30?
author: Valeria R.

description: Darren, Darren, Darren! There is an adage in the community, "is that drink Castro-worthy?"  Toad Hall IS!
author: Ms. C.

description:
So is Toad Hall up to its "old tricks"?

At a recent happy hour experience - all are allowed in with basic reviews of our IDs except one African American friend is NOT allowed in because his ID is a few weeks expired.  The picture is STILL HIM and his Birthday HAS NOT CHANGED.  He can get through security at the friggin AIRPORT with an expired ID - but not into Toad Hall?

Hmmmm - one has to wonder... And just think of all that money they lost!  So we ALL went to The Mix where you can be a friggin Green Martian for all they care!

Anyway.  Carry on...
author: Jim S.

description:
How to describe this place? BORING. They do have clean restrooms and some of the staff is eye candy. That being said. The drinks are weak. The patio for smoking plays videos, but sadly there is no music outside. Probably due to the fact that there are people living directly above. The patio is ok. It's the place to go if you want to have a drink and smoke at the same time. The staff varies from fun, flirtatious to down right rude..... So you have to find the server you like and stick with that person. They are owners of Badlands across the street and it appears they put more emphasis on it than Toad Hall. It could be a fun after work hang out, but it just lacks a fun vibe.
That being said it's not bad, just an average place to go to have a cocktail.
author: David R.

description:
This was my first time in the Castro. What a magnificent first time it was!

I was with my two best gays and one of my best girls. We had already spent some time in the Mission, so we were good and drunk by the time we got here. There was a short line outside which moved quickly; $2 cover and then we were in. 

Loooove the music, love the music videos, love the space for dancing. And oh my god, the dancing! The joy of not having to fend off creepy randos! The euphoria of not being bothered by drunk frat guys! I'm never going to a straight bar again.

The drinks were strong and cheap, so kudos. I don't really remember leaving, so thanks Long Island Iced Tea! There was this one guy who was being weird with me and my friend, like he expected us to buy him a drink or something? We sent him on his way.

Thanks Toad Hall, I will be back! :D
author: Nora H.

description: Horrible! I know when I am drunk and I amn't. Though these bitches can't tell the difference. They attract the least of Castro and that's what they are!
author: Baris B.

description: Love Toad Hall! Went in the other night right before Happy Hour ended at 9pm. The bartender suggested we order the two drinks immediately (2 for 1) before happy hour ended; so sweet! The drinks are pretty cheap and pretty strong! Will say for a Friday night it was kind of dead but I didn't mind, was able to get a seat so that's nice. They play Top 40 hits and come classics, the perfect selection to dance to! Toad Hall is fun but often overlooked.
author: Moni E.

description:
Went here on a Saturday night, empty and bad music. Only two people on the dance floor for the hour we were there. The bartender was super friendly though and the drinks were okay. It was pretty empty so we were able to get drinks right away and a table.

Just grab a quick drink from here and then quickly move on or skip this place all together.
author: T F.

description:
Toad Hall was certainly a welcomed surprise in the Castro. Its plain and boring street exterior may make one pass, its interior, the crowd, and the experience is certainly not. 

The atmosphere almost feels like a New York style loft with hip hop music (Hip Hop in the Castro? I know? Crazy thought?) and is certainly comfortable with its bars and booths. The outdoor patio area is certainly comfortable and a much welcomed reprieve from a crowded interior. 

The drinks are poured well and are decently priced. The bartenders are quick and certainly make you feel comfortable. 

All in all a great place to hit up in the Castro!
author: Chad Y.

description: Two for one drink specials, I am in! Across from Badlands is this great bar with even greater cocktails. I never thought of myself as someone who would or could drink so much in one evening, but it happened here. I wasn't expecting a two for one special, but I jumped in thinking "great I will only have to buy one drink". The drinks were really good, and big, and the music was great so we got a second round-that means we were up to four drinks each. After some good conversation and more good music, we got another round. Six drinks later we finally moved onto the next place, but always recommend making Toad Hall your first stop.
author: Liz G.

description:
Not a bad place.  I like the music that is played here, and I am a fan of video bars.  

I'm not big on the Castro, it is not so much my scene, but this bar is nice.  Bartenders are VERY nice.  I must admit that the service at the bars I have frequented in the City has gotten better but they are super nice here!  I'm a smoker, so I appreciate not having to go into the streets to get my cancer fix.  Outdoor bar and patio are great!  I just can't deal with the crowds sometimes....drives me a little batty.  I'm more of a dive bar guy.
author: Lambert C.

description: What a great spot in the Castro! Only $2 cover, and the drinks are around $5-$6!  What I really liked was the music.  It's definitely a place where I could dance all night long!
author: Vira P.

description: Cheap drinks, good music and dancing area, wonderful outdoor patio, great crowd. What more can you ask for?
author: Vivian H.

description:
i have lived in San Francisco for nearly 20 years.  I have hosted a happy hour every Friday for 10 years.  I keep wanting to have Happy Hour at Toad Hall, but a large percentage of us drink white wine (duh, it's California).  They typically stock one bottle of some white, which I will want to myself. 

This is not difficult...have several bottles of chardonnay on hand.  It doesn't go bad.  This is my third and last complaint before I know that I will never tell anyone to visit this bar.  Sad, considering that Toad Hall is a legendary place.  Legendary in location alone.  Watch it as well, the bar backs will steal your drinks way before you are done and the bartenders pour miserable pours unless you ask for chardonnay at the back bar from a woman who know her stuff!  She should own the place! 

Bottom line:  The owners of Sadlands (Badlands) need to understand that a is a different client.  I would rather cut my eyes out with a grapefruit spoon than go to their sister bar, Badlands.  Not a glowing review.  Go elsewhere.
author: David R.

description:
OUTSTANDING SERVICE FOR TOAD HALL
Last nite me and friends went out for a few drinks trying to go to other bars to only stay at this Bar ...  Not Packed, Not Loud, in fact we were the only ones there but none the less outstanding Bar service by Bar-Tender (John)   he made sure our drinks and Stay was Great.  Plus he was a little eye candy for me. But loved my stay here, this is one of my favoritest Bars in the Castro. 
We just had Jager Bomb shots and I was having shots of Jack Daniels. 
Loved my time there.  
5 Great Stars!
author: Anthony J G.

description:
For its Wind-in-the-Willows-meets-Old-Friendly-Castro name, Toad Hall has some pretty mean-spirited and impersonal employees.

I had a little tote bag that I left on the patio. Suddenly the patio closes (at 1:30, mind you), and they refuse to let me back there to look for it. While assertively explaining (but neither shouting nor becoming physical) that all I want to do is go find my own property after two hours of patronizing their business, I get treated with the most bizarre hostility: things like "He already tried that excuse" and "Maybe if you had a better attitude" and so on. The best part was  having one employee tell me that the bag isn't there and the other tell me that I can come get it the next day. This was followed by a shove.

It's like they learned how to interact with friendly, paying customers from a TV movie about corrupt cops.
author: Joel S.

description:
Two-for-one drinks during Happy Hour. And these drinks are STRONG. As my friend put it, "obviously, it's the Castro!"

They also have a smoking patio in the back.

Nuff said.
author: Rachel G.

description:
This place is pretty cool. I think it's from the same owner as Badlands. I give it an extra star because it has one of the best outdoor patios in The Castro. If you're not a smoker, don't spend too much time out here as it can get pretty smokey even though it is outdoors and all.

I've never had a problem with the staff here at all. The barbacks continuously circle the venue to grab empty glasses from the wells and tables so that they don't accumulate through the night and they usually do it with a smile on their face,

The clientle tends to be a little on the older side...like 30 and over older. Nothing wrong with that, it's just a noticeable fact from hanging out here a  few times.
author: Trav M.

description: Badlands part two. I can't quite figure out its identity. Doesn't seem to do anything that unique of special. But it's here. It's queer. I'm used to it.
author: Sean B.

description: This bar has amazing music. That was the draw. So fun. HOWEVER, my phone was stolen within 20 minutes of arrival. It was zipped within in my purse and I was dancing with the purse in front of me. When I mentioned to the staff that my phone had been stolen (I have never had my phone stolen in 7 years), they blamed me for not being aware. Also, I was not informed about the disclaimer... apparently, it happens to girls all the time here. If you go, do not bring any belongings. Just your dancing shoes and dagger eyes for that fool that stole my phone.
author: Jessica P.

description: Toad Hall wasn't our first choice when we got to Castro Street, but I'm glad we decided to come here over waiting in the ridiculous line at Bad Lands. There was no wait to get inside, and although we were handed fliers to be careful with our phones and wallets due to thieves, we weren't discouraged. The place was pretty packed, but not overly full, so there was room to dance and enjoy ourselves. We got a seat in the corner to feel the place out, and it was the perfect view to witness all the flamboyant dancers and couples. It was an awesome night full of fun and laughter and I would definitely return, but only if my boyfriend gets me a cocktail that's less sweet than their featured ones.
author: Monica V.

description: Great place, casual, outside patio where you can smoke or not, reasonable drink prices, fun and generally friendly crowd. I always meet some interesting so and so there to chat with. Would choose this place over Badlands or Mix any day or night. Well, I'd go to Mix just to see the one bartender. I don't know his name but that doesn't really matter :) Only problem here like everywhere else is finding parking but helloooo San Francisco, it's like that but especially now since they tore up Castro and we're missing basically a whole street to park on. If you are taking PT, who cares? Prefer the outside to the inside with the convenient no line bathroom. Two for one drinks would be oh so much better if beer were a drink... ":| and I'd live there if that were the case! (get it? Case lol)
author: David J.

description:
This place was alright. They were having a special event 3 weeks ago on a Sunday when I went after having an already awesome day. My friend and I went in and here and they had a sign up that said free girls and beer HAHA funny. So went inside and they had leaning tower of jello shots. 10 for 3 bucks! well i had that and my friend got the free bottomless beer. 

I have to say the shots were enough for me. The vibe was really mellow. The bathrooms were gross. The back outdoor patio was full so we couldn't even sit outside but it looked really nice. So all in all this bar was alright, lol the sign was a little deceiving though cuz there really were no girls in there.
author: Genneth L.

description:
Whenever we go out in the Castro, we usually head to the Lookout, then The Cafe or Badlands. Some friends suggested that we try Toad Hall for a change. Cool, we like checking out new places, and the Castro usually does not disappoint.

The drinks were cheap and STRONG (typical of Castro bars). The Long Island's were quite deadly. I marveled over how spacious Toad Hall is. I couldn't tell if it's because the venue is larger than other bars, or if it's because fewer people come here. Either way, I was happy. Then things started to go horribly wrong...

One of our friends made the mistake of throwing an empty, plastic liquor bottle into the trash can near the bar. You know, one of those little liquor bottles you get on the plane. The bartender immediately escorted him out. Something about putting their liquor license at risk. It was stupid of our friend to do that right under the bartender's nose. Very stupid. I get that the bar has to follow certain rules and regulations, uphold certain standards, etc. What I don't get is why the bartender was so rude to the rest of us.

There were about 15 people in our group. Most people had no idea what had just happened or why it had happened. We asked the bartender, very politely, what was going on. Instead of just answering the question in a reasonable manner, he immediately snapped at us, accused us of wanting to cause trouble and threatened to call the police. Uhh, wow. It all makes sense now. This is why this place is so empty. Rude bartenders. Our group, of course, took off immediately to another bar.
author: Waz W.

description: A gay bar with a patio, in San Francisco? Sold! Had a great time here, the guys selling jello shots as if they were girl scout cookies cracked me up. It's a nice casual place to meet friends for a drink. Will definitely be back.
author: Breylan D.

description:
Toad Hall is one of our group of friends' go to places in the Castro. Their Happy Hour is very similar to that of Badlands. 2-for-1's are great and their $5 specials are great, too.

The dance floor is very small, but the outdoor patio compensates for it. The staff here are friendly and remember you very quickly. Thanks Pam for always making me feel welcomed!

Music is usually good; except for the 4-5 track run of Euro pop which sounds like crap. Other than that, Toad Hall is a solid bet on good drinks, good vibes, and good times.
author: Mike N.

description:
Word of the Day (via Urban Dictionary):

Liquid Courage: (noun) Used when explaining alcohol as a catalyst for bravery, particularly in a party or public setting.

Used in a Sentence:

After consuming an [x] amount of liquid courage, Ally C. found herself metamorphosing from a shy sober caterpillar into a boisterous drunken butterfly as she spewed her wings across Toad Hall's main stage and drunkenly slurred the words to Mariah Carey's "We Belong Together" with such fervor and passion in front of a crowd of fifty people.
author: Ally C.

description: Yay for Toad Hall!!  Like others have mentioned, it's very similar to Badlands in that it's set up a lot like it, and they have awesome drink specials all the time.  It also has an outdoor patio with another bar for smoking or chilling outside on a warm afternoon.  The bartenders are AWESOME -- so friendly and attentive (and of course adorable for the most part).  The bathrooms are unisex which I actually like -- my BFF Jason and I can go pee together, yay!  Always a positive vibe here.  Less crowded than Badlands too.
author: Heather K.

description: This is my favorite spot to be the straight guy at the gay bar. The patio is awesome and the drag shows are top notch. Four stars because it's hard for me find something to drink.. But I'm obviously not the target market. Next season of drag race it's going down. Pro tip, get to the front of the stage earliesh to snag a good standing spot, it gets hella crowded on show nights!
author: nes o.

description:
Happy Hour deal seems pretty good...everyone was two-fisting (and not in a SOMA sort of way.)

Clean, lots of room, big windows for people watching and a nice patio area in back.
author: Ken B.

description: 2-for-1 happy hour from 5-9 on weekdays. Karaoke on Tuesdays. Clean bathrooms. Not too stuffy. Smoking patio. These are all good things. The bartender I had patiently explained the drink deals and I was served promptly. The crowd was loud, but I think it'd be odd if it weren't.
author: Robert A.

description:
There's lots of bars in the Castro, but I like Toad Hall because I like to think that if the Mix (which is a fun, neighborhood bar) and Badlands (which can be fun but it usually overrun with B&T) had a baby, they would call it Toad Hall. It's like any bar I suppose, but it has a pretty decent vibe. I enjoy it for the smoking patio in the back (since I hate to have to go outside on the street to have a cigarette). 

Usually have pretty decent drink specials, and I enjoy the nights when they have TV playing and everyone gets into the show. Music is pretty decent (standard dance and top 40 stuff). It can get a little busy/packed, which is kinda annoying at times. But it's a fun place to enjoy a simple night out with friends to have fun.

Why the "so-so" review. Well, there's nothing necessarily about it that makes it stick out. It delivers, but nothing unique.
author: Nicolas H.

description: A nice, fun place.   The music is a trifle loud but the cocktails are good and the bartenders look delicious
author: Mike B.

description: Toad Hall has been my "go-to" bar in the Castro ever since I turned 21. I love both the indoor area, and the outdoor back patio. Whenever I can't decide which bar to go to first, I always end up here! Definitely would love to go back on a Tuesday for their weekly karaoke night!
author: Evan A.

description:
Nice heated patio area in the back, which gets really crowded after... well, 5:30. So come early if you're planning on seating somewhere. Gets really loud too.

The happy hour is very cheap too (2 cocktails for ~$6), drinks are kind of crappy though, but when I need to be drunk early for cheap, I know where to go!

Castro-style music.
author: Nathan B.

description:
When some friends texted me to meet them here I was a little confused by the choice. I don't have any objection to hanging out at gay bars. I generally prefer having the illusion, even if unlikely, that it's possibly to meet women when I'm out drinking.

This is either a short bus ride from the Mission, 33 Stanyan, or a longish uphill walk; I got lucky and barely caught the bus.

I didn't immediately notice that there was a patio in the back so when I walked in and didn't see my friends I thought I might have gone to the wrong place. Once I walked around a bit I figured it out. The patio is a little small but very nice with a separate bar so you don't have to walk back in every time you drink.

There are flyers stuck to the walls promoting the drink specials, each one had a different drink with the description and the price and they were tacked up all over in no order or pattern. I don't have a crippling OCD, just enough for something like this to bug me. to be honest I was a little overwhelmed. I sat and talked to my friends a little at first without getting a drink but they weren't having it and berated me until I went up to the bar.

I tried the drink specials called a "strawberry cosmo" listed for $5. That alone is a good deal. When the bartender started making two I was confused and asked him if he'd heard that I just wanted one, his reply was " It's two for one". On top of that they were both doubles. What I'm getting at is that you get giant cocktails here for $2.50 each.

I was reading a text on our way out and walking kind of slow so my friends accused me of cruising the bar. My reply was that just because I'm not interested doesn't mean I don't like the attention.
author: Manny F.

description:
Really enjoy this place, mostly because they never get that crowded. I mean, theres usually a lot of people but the place is pretty roomy and has a very nice back patio. You rarely find yourself swimming through a crowd of people just to get to the rest room. They also have a great happy hour and even after happy hour drinks are decently priced.

They play some great music too and show the music video to boot.
author: Kevin K.

description: Stopped by last Sunday not long after the bar opened. Only a handful of patrons at this time, however, bartender (with the short close cropped  beard) was too busy texting to notice we arrived. Eventually he walks over and not a sound from him as he looks at us. Not a "hello" or "what may I get you?" -- nothing. It seems as if we had bothered him by coming even in. We ordered 4 drinks and headed outside to the patio. Came back 10 minutes later to order another round and again, bartender totally focused on his texting. Being totally ignored by this loon we left. It's shame as even though we live in the area we will not be back.
author: Bobby J.

description:
TOAD is the best.  It is my absolute favorite place to go on an off night.  The drinks are stiff and way too cheap plus they have an outdoor patio which is always heated.  In fact, drinks are so cheap that with ten dollars you WILL ruin the earlier half of the following work day.

Avoid it on Friday or Saturday nights because it is packed and the 2 for 1 deals end early.  

Also - straight ladies, not a place to go trolling for men.  Duh.
author: Catherine L.

description:
This place has a great happy hour. Where else can you get 2 long island ice teas for 6 bucks. Sure these aren't the perfect LIIT's poured and mixed in SF, but you get what you pay for.

And when the drinks are a' pourin' the crowd seems to get a bit more entertainin'. It's really funny what you can see at 3 PM in the afternoon:

     * A drunk guy flirting with every guy in the club, obviously way above his tolerance level, touching anyone he sees in plain site, ultimately getting escorted out of Toad Hall resulting in his next happy hour endeavor across the street at Badlands (owned by the same owner of Toad Hall)
     * Drunk guys making out with other drunk guys.
     * Birthday parties galore, starting the night early with a pre-drink, hoping that they make it through dinner (or in some cases through happy hour).

So if you're looking for a good time with cheap drinks, give Toad Hall a try. It also has a fun and hip interior with cascading water feature in the back of the front bar (very posh like). It's also fun to seat by the bar window--you'll get a good laugh at the people walking by...it is the Castro after all and anything goes in the Castro (especially during happy hour).
author: Andrew S.

description: How can you go wrong with 2 for 1 drink specials, great music, eye-candy and an overall great vibe?!?! Uh, yeah...you can't! I can't wait to go back :)
author: Abby R.

description: I'm in LOVE. It was a beautiful saturday afternoon and my sister was meeting some friends here so I hopped right over. 3pm on a saturday and drinks were buy one get the 2nd for $1! Not house liquor but something legit like I want to say Absolute. Started with a bloody mary oh wait started with two and we all found a comfy table on the patio. There were flat screens playing Brit videos and I realized why do I never come to the Castro this is heaven - two for one drinks, a fun hip patio playing music videos and the nicest bar tender ever she was SO SWEET. Tip 'em well friends. I'll be back soon!
author: Sarah R.

description:
I used to love this bar but after the experience i had last night i don't think I'll EVER go back. BEWARE OF RUDE employees of the establishment! Avoid this bar if you can!
If i could give this place zero stars, I would! It is terrible! The restrooms are disgusting and the space is too small. Go to Badlands instead!!!

First of all the bouncer insulted my best friend telling her she looked 10 years older in her drivers license and accused her repeatedly of it being her mothers! He then proceeds to yell at us when we tried to validate its authenticity.

Second, the bartenders were extremely rude, one told us "he was there to make our drinks, not hear about the problems with the bouncer!"
author: Courtney C.

description:
Always have a good time, smoking patio out back, great bartenders and staff!

Honestly, the intensity at Badlands ALWAYS sends me packing to chill and conversate with my friends at Toads. We end up here many many nights getting shitty and never regret it.

Most of my friends agree, "we'll take a regular Toad Hall night over a busy bar any day."

But honestly, check these bartenders out, some of the nicest and fastest servers in town!
author: Phillip Alvarado A.

description:
There was a hot, beefy bartender working. Automatic +1 star =P

He also made all my ($5) drinks, and they were all good and strong. A good mix of music. No cover made it even better.

Came in on a Saturday around 9pm, to a decent crowd, but it became VERY crowded by midnight. I'd say that's a good thing.

The crowd seemed 30+, so I felt a little young here, but I'd come back if the bartender were still there.

Also: One urinal + two stalls.
author: Justin D.

description:
This place is filled with such beautiful and happy people. It's teeming with good vibes, nice strong drinks, and if you can manage to spend a visit here without feeling the need to dance or do something spontaneous, then you my friend, have no soul. 

I have much love for the patio and extra bar in the back.
author: Loli L.

description:
The way I see it is TH is Badland's less slutty younger sister. 

Badland's has her patio in the open cause she's a whore and lets the boys check each other out and attract them in like bugs to streetlights. TH's windows are tinted black so you can't see inside her cooch without getting up close to the window, and her patio is in the back where you can't see people walking by but there's actually more room for boys to mingle. 

Badland's lets her boys pee in the open urinals without doors next to the dance floor but TH is more conservative and offers stalls in closed doors. 

The bartenders are the same since they work both girls, though Badlands definitely attracts the sluttier, hotter boys cause TH is still figuring out how to reel in the skanks.
author: Allen L.

description: Nice smoking patio in back, the music ain't bad, two-for-one drink specials, a mellow vibe, and the lady bartender in the patio area is super-nice. What's not to love?
author: Robert F.

description:
John the bartender, you're the reason I go to the toad.  Of course the cheap drinks are a HUGE plus.  

Honestly, everyone at toad hall is super nice and friendly...never had a bad experience.
author: David D.

description:
This place is becoming the default location for my friends and me when we want to dance in the Castro on a Saturday night (partially because the line to get into Badlands is always so long). I like to call Toad Hall Badlands 0.5 because it has the same vibe but isn't as messy or crowded. The bar is on the smaller side, but the outdoor patio is pretty spacious. Drinks are as strong as Badlands' which we all know is essential. If you want to actually be able to dance and chat with your friends, you should definitely check out Toad Hall. Oh yeah...we've actually gotten the DJ to take a few of our music requests.

~A
author: Alex C.

description: Find a server/bartender you like and stick with that person!!! Other than the fact that this place gets packed, I enjoy coming here with my friends.
author: Kat Z.

description: Awesome karaoke place and friendly people. Prices decent. Only complaint is they don't take card.
author: Mindy P.

description:
I went here with my friend once.... We hung out in the patio. It was a lot of fun... The disco ball is a ncie touch and there is plenty of room to mvoe around.

Now where are those cute straight boys?
author: Lana P.

description:
What can I say about TOAD HALL that hasnt been said yet? Its a fun little place to go when you want to give BADLANDS a little break. Its right across the street so if your not diggin the music at BL for the moment...Just cross the street and you'll def walk into Gaga, Britney, Beyonce, Whitney and without a doubt you'll be dancing, that night you won't be taking no calls cause you'll be dancing! Its only good on the weekends though since its practically DEAD on the weekdays. There's literally like maybe 7-8 people here at most during weekdays. 

The drinks are good and fair, oddly enough EVERYTIME i go here with my BFF we always end up getting THE SAME bartender! so odd. I do have a little gripe about the bar service though... ONE NIGHT we went here and Ive maybe had one too many patron shots and I requested 2 glasses of water at the bar... they gave me 2 BUT the bartender used the same glass that has been sitting, used, on top of the bar, and filled it up with water then handed it to me. I was fucked up BUT I wasn't that FUCKED UP. I obviously did NOT drink it but...Dang! Nasty. After that I def wo'nt be ordering no damn glasses of water, or any other type of drink, up in this place. No maam.

Other than that the smoking area in the back is fairly nice to hangout in, Had a few drunken moments here and there. Overall good place to go and be chill and dance every now and then but we weary of the nastiness that's going on the bar.

p.s Its so funny cause I've been reading other people's comments about Toad Hall being somewhat of a HIP HOP music playing Bar... I don't know where THIS is coming from. Rihanna, Whitney, Mariah, Beyonce, Kelly Rowland etc is NOT hip hop. crazy. The most "hip-hop" type of music I've heard them play was Mariah's Up Out My Face... OK THEN...
author: Lorénz B.

description: This is a great place to go to meet new people and to dance. I wish the dance floor was a little bit bigger and the lighting was more flashy and attractive. It seems that have limited colors. Fuchsia purple red. The bar is definitely appealing. The colors, the layout. It's magnificent. I like how they have an outdoor patio so I could head to the back and have a smoke if I wanted to. Dress casual and make sure you're with friends you can trust because this is a mixed crowd. Some people (customers) look sketch, although the may not be. Just be safe!!!
author: Kevin C.

description:
Toad Hall is currently my favorite place to dance in the Castro... for one reason, or two.

1.) The bartenders aren't bat____ crazy the way that the bartenders are at QBar.
2.) It is almost identical to Badlands... except fewer people go there, or it is larger... or there are fewer people per square foot. The bottom line is, there is ample room to dance and you aren't going to have a drink spilled all over you.

oh...
and
3.) there is a smoking patio that is actually outside.
author: Russell Allen E.

description: I don't support bar owners who don't support the community.  Guys who leave storefronts empty for years, don't need my money.  Plenty of other place to drink in the neighborhood.
author: EC N.

description:
My favorite gay and I love to come here after work on Fridays to unwind from the hell that is the work week.  Before I go on, ask yourself, how many places do you know of where you can get strong 2-for-1 top shelf liquor drinks for $5-6?

That's what I thought... And that, in and of itself, is worth 5 stars to me. 

The poppy music videos are fun and the outdoor patio is great when the weather is nice, though I'm not a huge fan of the smokiness out there.  There's a dance floor and when I've had an especially rough week, I've been known to tear it up on occasion.  I've never had a problem with the staff, and typically everyone seems to be in a good spirits when I've been there (workers and patrons alike).  Go on, give Toad Hall a try!
author: Laura C.

description:
Wow...! I really like this place. Cheap alcohol and got some Hot Bartenders. Good place to make new friends too.

If you see me here, say hi. We all need good friends.
author: Joseph M.

description: An excellent place for drinks. Bar staff is friendly and generous with the pouring.  Prices are cheap!
author: Frank L.

description:
To the bartender in the middle at the bar last night:

Confused about why your section was consistently empty most of the entire night? Perhaps stop rudely swatting away every patron that stands within 3 ft of your section of the bar. We know you want money. But realize that we also do remember you when we want to go back for our second (or third (or fourth (or fifth))) drink. I went to the other two bartenders for the rest of the night (even though it meant waiting in line) because there was no way in hell I was going to give you my money.

From the music videos to the crowd to the christmas lights, Toad Hall is basically a mirror of Badlands except it's generally less crowded (plus) and there isn't a designated sectioned off dancefloor. Love the patio too.  3.5/5
author: Charles T.

description:
Awesome happy hour! drinks are the cheapest Ive seen in a while. Cute patio. Fun music videos but no one was dancing. 

Only one bathroom.=( Parking sucks around here.
author: E. Y. G.

description: Decent music, shitty bartenders, ONE for the entire bar on a Thursday night.  Not too crowded but could use someone a bit more attentive.
author: Michael B.

description: Best dancing in the Castro. Good patio. 2 for 1 happy hour! Don't get chlamydia. But if you do get chlamydia you can go next door to get tested for it.
author: Aaron H.

description:
THIS BAR EFFING SUCKED! 

Well only in the beginning I have to admit. 

If you read the previous post....I'm that girl who couldn't get into the bar because I allegedly was using my mother's ID. ARE YOU KIDDING ME? 

Then this bouncer had the audacity to pass around my ID to other people in line to have them approve or disapprove"does this ID look like her?" Where does he get off thinking I want my ID passed around a bunch of drunk flames who really don't give a crap if I come in or not....I have a vagina LOL 

Long story short.....had a WAAAAAAAAY better time dancing at Badlands across the street and wished I had stayed there for the remainder of the night 

Only perk...getting free drinks from a lesbian couple and burning 1000's of calories on the dance floor with my bff's 

STRAIGHT GIRLS BEWARE...THE BOUNCER IS RUDE AND A MAJOR JERKOFF! ! ! !
author: Sachi P.

description:
Well............

For me, it's just that there was no one here when I went, the atmosphere depressed me and the bartender didn't have much to say to me at all, even thought there were not many people around....

It just didn't work for me, but maybe I went on a bad night?
author: Jason B.

description:
It's gay. It's a bar. It's a gar bar. Amazing.

Cheap, strong drinks. Friendly staff and bar teders. Some weirdos can be in there from time to time from what I've seen (you know, the random drunk dude with missing clothing), but overall it's a cool place.
author: Erik B.

description: it was really busy when i went and they charged a cover fee, which was 5 dollars i believe. The place was alright, the back smelled pretty bad with all the cigarette smoke and i want to say sewage water from the restrooms too. But it seems to have a good crowd and i enjoyed the music. It located centrally so it was really easy to go bar hopping
author: Lily S.

description: Been here a few times, drinks are always super strong (almost too strong) but the crowd is just right. Hipper younger people and great music. Never had to wait in line to get in this place!
author: Nick B.

description: I had a lot of fun here! the drinks were stiff and cheap, and they played great music. I especially love all the screens where they play the music videos (even though it's a bit distracting). Has a fantastic patio (even though it was raining when i was there). The only thing is the dance floor is kind of tiny, but whatever.
author: James F.

description:
This place is Ah-May-Zhing.  I am a straight woman with impeccable bone structure and I have never felt so important to gay men in my entire life.  This place has a little stage that the most insecure patrons can use to pretend that they have a chance of making it to the top 20 of So You Think You Can Dance. (yes, I am one of those patrons)  On three separate occasions I almost fell off of the two foot high stage.  I blame the Ketel One, gravity and too much booty popping.   

Also, this is a gay bar.
author: Mimi V.

description: I didn't really care for either the atmosphere or the layout of Toad Hall; I went on a Saturday night hoping to do some dancing but I was sadly disappointed. The dance floor was microscopic and the bar was PACKED with people. I seriously couldn't move. A lot of people advertise how awesome the outside patio is; that was just as packed and stunk of cigarette smoke. The music was a collection of the same artists (for example, they played like 4 Rihanna songs in a row). Other than the reasonably priced mixed drinks, I don't know what people see in this bar.
author: Tommy C.

description:
I would probably give this place 3 or 3.5 stars.  

I checked this place out for the first time last night (Saturday night) - got in around 11:00pm.  No cover, there was a line of about 15 or 20 people, but the line moved fairly quickly.  It's basically one large room with a full bar, and an outdoor patio/smoking area outside.  The outside area has a smaller bar.

The place was fairly packed.  Wait at the bar was pretty reasonable - while the bar was pretty full, I didn't have to wait more than 5 minutes to get my drink order in.  Prices were cheap too - 5 or 6 bucks for a Jack and Coke.  Like a lot of gay bars, they don't go chinzy on the alcohol so the drinks were strong.  

Music was pretty standard - they were playing 80's at first - Michael Jackson, Madonna, etc. and then switched over to mainstream hip hop/club music.  

Overall, I'll probably be back - it wasn't a standout or crappy place.  I'm always down for no cover and cheap drinks though :)
author: Laura C.

description: For a first gay bar experience, not that bad. The place had a $2 cover at the door, but once inside, the drinks were cheap (and tasty) while the music was loud and pumping. I didn't get a chance to hit the dance floor since I was already exhausted from earlier music at drinking at Rickhouse, but from what my friend said, it was crowded and a bit dangerous with all the glass on the floor. For a first time, 4 stars. A fun night that I wouldn't mind having again!
author: Jessica H.

description: I've only been to Toad Hall Bar once so take my review with a grain of salt but the staff was incredibly unfriendly. We arrived after 1AM and the bar was fairly empty. My friend who wasn't drinking was sitting at the bar and was asked to move. There were plenty of available seats at the bar so I'm not really sure where the request came from but I didn't read too much into it. Later (around 1:30AM... when the bar has even less people) we were all standing next to a table and I (being lazy) pulled out a stool from the table. It couldn't have been more than a foot from the table but I was asked to put it back shortly thereafter. Both requests came with a bit of attitude but I'm not sure why. Ah well. I'll go back again and give a second chance.
author: Matthew R.

description: Toad hall is a great bar in the Castro for the not young but not old either! The mix-ologists make a pretty mean drink and the happy hour can't be beat!
