We go often and have gotten to know some of the staff! Steven makes a fabulous black cherry Russian! Jason the best bar back around (why he isn't mixing drinks with that killer smile of his is beyond me) is always fun and welcoming! Go for the cocktails, stay for the fun!
author: Joaquin G.

description: Good music, less crowded than badlands. Some super amazing bouncer at the door. He looks scary but don't worry, he won't bite.
author: Madison P.

description:
This review is in reference to the late night time-slot when you play hip-hop music. 

THANK YOU!

One of the biggest reasons I don't like to go dancing in the Castro is because it's all mmm-ch mmm-ch techno. Which is fine for two songs... but it gets old quickly. 

So imagine my surprise when we arrive at Toad Hall last night for my friend's birthday and they're playing Jay-Z when we walk inside. 

"Uhh.... is that 'Run This Town?' Featuring my girl Rihanna? With a little ditty from Kanye?" It sure was. And it was followed by some more Beyonce, Kanye, Jay-Z and other pop/hip-hop artists. 

So refreshing. I danced my pretty little heart out. Which I do about twice a year, so now I've completed my 2009 quota.
author: Jared S.

description:
Crazy DJ alert!  Story below!  I guess you have to take the bad with the good...

I like this bar...good ambiance, fun people, friendly bartenders, and I love the pop music.  I love the unisex bathrooms.  And it is definitely Badlands-lite.   Same concept without a big dance space.  

The one thing I feel obligated to report, however, is that the resident DJ there seems more concerned with seasonal decorations than the bar's patrons....and is possibly a little crazy.

My friend and I went there one night not too long after New Year's Eve, and they still had balloon decorations up.  You know, those long ones that people twist into animals.  So I reached up and twisted one for a bit.  Didn't harm it at all.  But so someone (old) taps me and is like, "If you don't stop doing that you'll have to leave."  And I thought he was a random (old) schmoe making a joke and trying to hit on me , so I just laughed and was all "good one!"  and just kept twiddling.  At which point his (old) eyes got all crazy, he lost touch with reality and SHOVED me!  And screamed, "That's it! You're out!"  But then he just hi-tailed it back to the DJ booth, leaving me and my friend stunned.  What gives, buddy? Cracked out?  Had a bad day? Obsessed with the safety of your balloons that have been up for over a week?  

Regardless of the fact that, okay, I admit that I probably shouldn't have been messing with the decorations, I have difficulty thinking of circumstances in which it's okay to SHOVE customers.  We left, cause he was obviously NUTS! and kinda scary (old). and I avoid the bar now when he's there.  Creepy!!!!  So take that (old) man!  You play decent music but you need a chill pill!
author: Dwayne A.

description:
I'm surprised i never really Yelped about Toad Hall.  Better late than never, i guess.

Long review short... Toad Hall is Badlands without the dancing.  I mean, really.  It is.  In fact, im under the impression that the owners of Badlands (SF and Sac) also own Toad Hall, which would explain a lot.

Regardless of who owns Toad Hall, its actually a nice place to get drinks.  Good bar space and plenty of seating inside and a nice heated patio in the back with its own bar.  The heated element is very nice because it really does make the patio comfortable during colder nights, which are often in SF.

Prices are good and the music is good too.  More mix of hip hop and dance music compared to Badlands.  Which makes sense to me because i feel Toad Hall is more of a bar than a club, meaning its a place to grab drinks and hang out and listen to music vs. go and dance.

My only critique is one for the majority of Castro: When will Castro embrace the beauty of plastic.  Credit cards are amazing and convenient for everyone involved.
author: Reuben D.

description:
I have only been to Toad Hall once for a Happy Hour birthday celebration.  The two for one drink special was awesome, and the outdoor seating was great! I went with a group of people that I really like and we pretty much kept to ourselves, so I can't really say much about the crowd or the vibe here, since we kind of took over the back patio.

Overall, the staff was friendly and the booze was flowing steadily so I don't have any complaints!

I will definitely go back.
author: Amy S.

description:
Like a late bloomer, Toad Hall Bar finally came into its own... or maybe it got kissed by the right "princess" and Prince Charming popped out! SMOOCHES!

After a rather dismal time at Trigger, my friends and I decided to head to THB around 11PM. I wanted to "cleanse" my Trigger experience, as well as check out how THB was doing.

All in all, I left happy coz I had a good time!

- Bartenders were friendly as always and got our drinks in no time
- Place was not as packed as the last time I visited it so it was nice to be able to move around
- My favorite space is still the smoking patio since the crowd here is even more laid back, chilled out and friendly than the ones inside
- The bar out back in the patio is a life-saver if you don't want to go back in to the bar out front
- Bouncer was friendly, no-attitude kind of guy
- Music was still kinda "meh" but the crowd made up for that
- Unpretentious, friendly and diverse crowd made it a good night
- Made some new friends which is always fun
- The space was clean overall which is always a good thang
- As other reviewers has stated, its a mix of The Mix and Badlands

This "princess" love Toad Hall Bar long time! SMOOCHES!
author: Amit S.

description:
I accidentally left a sweater here after having a few. I called the next day hoping that by chance one of the employees picked it up and saved it for me. They actually did! This has got to be the only bar in the castro with such kind service. 

I've never had anything but a great time here. Monday night's (Rupaul's Drag Race Night) are killer and they always have contestants of the show performing live from that season. Not to mention their famous 2-for-1 happy hours. 

A boy couldn't ask for more.
author: Derrick C.

description:
Ya know, as time has passed and other, far more creative bars have opened up in the Castro (and elsewhere), my lukewarm love for Toad Hall has become a more passive antipathy. With all due respect to certain staff members that I've known for years and will always admire, this place really represents a cynical approach to gay bars that I really have come to resent: just give them endlessly remixed (and looped) pop music and cheap strong drinks and they will come. 

This isn't social... it's toxic, Britney.

To think that this place took years to reopen is the height of irony.  I mean, it's just the Badlands with new paint, flatter screened TVs and what looks like FLOR tiles on the walls. The decor is totally uninspired, the small patio is filled with smoke and little else, and two-for-one well drinks offer is... a tease. I drink beer, thanks.

It's boring, beyond unoriginal, and we (the gay community, the boozehound community, the adult community...) can do better. In fact, other bars have... and I'll be going to them instead.
author: Aaron L.

description: I really tried to like this place. It's nicely located right in the Castro. Id really like it to be a bit better. There's times I've gone it's been quiet, times its been annoyingly loud with hipster overflow from Badlands.
author: Tom M.

description:
Eh.

I think the big problem I have with this place is that it is almost an exact replica of Badlands, right across the street.  I mean, it is much newer, and a tad "fancier", but the people and the (crappy) bartenders are pretty much the same.

In words:

*  Boring
*  Sanitized
*  White
*  Loud

Not my cup o' tea.  I'm goin' to Q Bar instead.
author: Michael D.

description:
I guess someone got the hint about how that 'Rainbow Bar' was destined to failure even before opening. Ha!

okay, so Toad Hall Bar it is. The "famous" cult gay bar that was located where the Walgreens is now. 

what this basically is... a solution to having Badlands get overcrowded. Just cross the street! Much like what they told our fellow men who were discriminated against a couple years ago...do you remember, gay community? 

so yeah, older men, Asian men, and everything in between. and by in-between i mean.. whatever older white men are into these days... i'm sure it's some other ethnicity other than white. meh~!

welcome to the Castro, Toad Hall. 

PS: the doorman didn't even know they had an ATM inside. Great! Training your staff helps.
author: Tomas V.

description: Hey Toad Hall, I still love your cheap drinks and your lack of cover, but your Saturday night DJ-ing needs a refresher course.  Why do you play two to three songs by the same artist in a row?  I love Ke$ha and Rihanna and Brittney and Gaga, but I don't want to be bashed in the head by a triumvirate of their tunes.  Just hit shuffle.  It's not too difficult.  Also, remixes are great when they make the song better or more danceable, but its sort of silly to play remixes that just elongate the song and add nothing but cheap bass thumping to its aural aesthetic.  Yes, I still shook my groove thang, but I got bored by the predictability of the music selection.
author: Jeremy G.

description:
It's my favorite place for happy hour. Very nice, low-key, great drinks and bartenders!

When the sun sets however, make sure there isn't a bachelorette party there if you'd like to meet boys...they seem to have these events frequently.
author: Andy D.

description: I absolutely love Toad Hall. Cheap drinks (especially during happy hour!) and always a great crowd. I always try and make it for karaoke on Tuesdays. It's a fabulous time.
author: Melissa B.

description:
2 for 1 happy hour from 3 to 9? check.
Sweet tea lemonade? double check! (cause they're 2 for 1. get it?)
author: Justin G.

description:
I can't believe someone below said this place was fancy. What planet did you land from?

Anyway, this bar is essentially an extension of Badlands across the street. Cheesy decor, awful music (I walked in as they were playing a remix of David Archiletta...Really?), and the same Badlands crowd. I also don't understand why they make the staff wear those cheesy toad hall shirts. Wouldn't you quit if you were forced to wear the same shit brown t-shirt everyday? My friends and I literally ran for the door after we chugged our drinks. I will give them one star for a semi-decent outdoor patio. 

Hate to be negative, but seriously, this was a joke.
author: Marcelo V.

description:
NOW OPEN.

If The Mix, Lime and Badlands had a baby it's name would be Toad Hall.

The place is definitely fancy, especially when considering it's in the Castro.  Decent sized indoor area with three wells for drinks and a large open area where dancing can take place but not a dance floor per say.  Video monitors, crazy loud music, cheap drinks.

The cool part is there's a large outdoor area (larger than The Mix I think) where you can also get drinks and smoke your lungs out.  They definitely closed up shop at 10 last night so not sure if the outdoor area will be open late night.

Overall a welcome addition to the Castro.  Three stars for now but definitely room to improve.  Sweet.
author: Evan L.

description:
Totally loved this bar till all the scary lesbians kept pushing me!! like seriously, did I just go to "their" bar and didn't get an invite? like so unfair!!! where are all the hot lipstick lesbians that love me at? 

But to be honest the vibe before the scaries came was awesome! (hip hop music) So the other vibe was that the bartenders were dancing, and making out with eachother.. and not that I am totally into gay guys making out, but it's an awesome scene to watch when your gay friends you came with are MAKING OUT WITH EVERYONE including the bartenders! I guess pride takes it out of people...
author: Nina M.

description: Toad Hall is a lot of fun.  Crowd is younger than I party with BUT boy did I enjoy myself!!!         F-U-N
author: Wes R.

description:
I like this place because I feel that the music is great. It's the closest thing to Hip-Hop on a Saturday night in the Castro. Although owned by the same owners as Badlands, the crowd here is anything but. The people here seem more down-to-earth and the ventilation is much better (with the exception with one night when their A/C wasn't working). 

It is relatively crowded on a Friday and Saturday night but not nearly as packed as Badlands. Sidebar: With all of these new bar/clubs popping up (i.e. Trigger, Toad Hall, The Cafe, Q Bar) I think that Badlands is in need of an update. Anyway, Toad Hall is fun and the music is fun and the crowd is fun. So go! Find me and ask me to dance! :)
author: Rylan C.

description: Simply put...Toad Hall makes me happy. Every time that I that my friends and I come, we always leave with great stories for the water cooler for the upcoming week, and sore feet, b/c we tore up the dance floor in our oxfords, stilettos, or super cute boots. Plus, $5 long island ice teas are always a good idea!
author: Orey J.

description:
Toad Hall seems to be the place I go to for drinks and a quick dance.  The drinks are pretty good and the price is not bad.  I usually end up paying around $5-7 per drink.  The bartender we had last friday was pretty cute and he gave me a free drink (wee!)

The music is REALLY good here but the downside is the small small dance floor.

I'm not a smoker but there is an outside smoking area with a bar and seating area, so its def a plus to have all that for those who do smoke.

I'm not sure what the cover's are here, sometimes when I come I have to pay and sometimes I don't.  I guess it depends on the night.

Best nights are Fridays and Saturdays.
author: Kameron K.

description: I think the main reason I liked this place so much was because of their happy hour (either 5-9pm or 7-9pm can't remember) but it included 2 for 1 cocktails -YAYUH!  Best believe my bf and I got a good buzz by the end of the night.  Very nice and nice-looking bartenders, nice ambiance and cozy patio for smokers with its own bar and tv screens.  The Castro in general is a great place but if you're lookin for a cheap drink check this place out!
author: T. Jay S.

description:
I LOVE TOAD HALL!! I was very excited the first time I went there and got 4 (strong) gin and tonics for $9.00! There might be other places in the City to get heavily intoxicated until 8:30 for $9.00 but I don't know about them.

(EDIT: Toad Hall has stopped their 2:1 drinks... now they are buy one get one for $1. Not as good a deal and not much better than other places in the Castro.) 

Every time I have visited, weeknights, I have always been able to find somewhere to sit with my friends. But, goodluck on weekends, it's very crowded and not many seats. The music is entertaining and every song is accompanied by its music video on screen.

There is a mini stage and plenty of room to dance. The DJs are usually nice and will (almost) play whatever song you request.

The bartenders are nice, the bathrooms are clean, I love the water décor behind the bar and the patio is a nice escape to get some fresh air. There is even a mini bar on the patio.

Castro bars tend to be crowded, humid and very loud. This place is sooo much better. 

Go to Toad Hall and take advantage of their 2 for 1 drinks! You won't be disappointed.
author: Melissa A.

description: Small Bar that is great for meeting friends for a couple drinks.
author: Rix G.

description:
Ooh!  Badlands North!
(one star for potential)

If capacity is 121 people inside (according to the doorman and the sign posted by the door), why create a "dance floor" that essentially forces your patrons to hug the wells?  And I'm not sure about that hole in the wall that spews out "smoke" for ambiance.  Seems a bit on the musty side to me.

I wish they would re-do the layout and make it more of a lounge.  Maybe switch up the music so it's not a poorly executed carbon-copy of its sister across the street.
author: Marcus C.

description: Oh, Toad Hall.  I have come to enjoy your company.  I was upset before, but you came through and brought great drink specials and a chill evening just when I needed it.  I love your patio.  I love that you don't do annoying events.  You are getting better, thank you!
author: Mike K.

description: I love the patio with the bar.  I am a social guy so I prefer clubs that encourage socializing.  Great spot, great drinks, with great friends!
author: James V.

description:
I just moved back to San Francisco after a brief hiatus when the pendulum closed. I remember the protest outside of badlands. When I heard the bar closed I was shocked. Now four years later, the place still is not open. I talked with a lot of people and yesterday we saw an A/V guy setting up the screens. We were guessing the place is going to open on MLK weekend. Will it be the new Pendulum is to soon to say.

Some people think that it will be a place that caters to a more upscale gay crowd. If it is going to be the new black bar of the Castro, then why wait so long to open it up is a question I have as well. Only time will tell. I have also heard people say that it is Les had no plans of making it the new Pendulum, he just wanted to wait for the fire to burn out on the scandal before opening up a place he wanted. 

Either way, it is sad that there is no place gay black and latinos can go to gather. We are the LGBT community, we know what discrimination is like. We should know better.
author: Robert Shawn W.

description:
Four words: Fantastic Friday Happy Hour! I've only been here a handful of times on other days (including Easter Sunday, but that's another story) but this is the place to be on Fridays! Certain drinks are two for one and still extremely affordable (in the $5-6 range for select mixed drinks). Plus you get a fun clientele - I've met old friends, made new friends, and take current friends here - and TVs playing your favourite 80s/90s/2000s hits overhead as you chill on the covered patio. (But if you want to dance, there's some space for that inside as well.) And if you get peckish, it's within stumbling distance of a bunch of different restaurants (and I do mean stumbling - those drinks can get pretty strong). 

It's got all the coziness of a neighbourhood bar with the high energy of a discotheque, and with enough space for both.
author: Joanne C.

description:
Been here a few times, and I honestly love it.

There aren't many places in the Castro that play a good mix of Britney and booty bumpin' music.  One night, I headed here for a little bar crawl action with friends, and we stumbled into Toad Hall.  Now, it definitely must have been GHETTO night or something...because they played rap song after rap song.  And I loved every second of it!!!

It was a refreshing change from the thumpa thumpa that happens across the street at Badlands.  

There are few opportunities where my inner ghetto black girl can come out and play.  And this is definitely a place where she gets to come out and shake her junk in the trunk.  Hey, I WAS raised in the 707 okkkkk.

Moderately priced drinks, and it's never really that crowded.  Good size back patio too with no cover.  LOVE IT!
author: Vince S.

description: Great atmosphere. 2 clean all-gender bathrooms to the delight of all of our trans and gender variant friends.  (though I hear you can see into the stall from the urnal?)  I love the water fall walls behind the bar. Great happy hour deal, somewhat older crowd during that time. The music and videos were a replica of Badlands during happy hour, only not quite as good as badlands -1 star for that, as they even played one song twice within the hour.  Nice patio with some heat lamps. A+ for effort on this place. I think it will improve.
author: Mark S.

description: We came here after refusing to pay cover everywhere else on a Thursday night for a few drinks, and ended up a few martinis deep. First of all they were served in regular glasses with ice (what kind of bartender serves a martini in a regular cup,  ice and a straw??) and on top of all that my boyfriend's glass was cracked.....it helped that the bartender bought that one but still, I can totally see why this place could never be able to charge cover. Ugghh.
author: Cody C.

description: I went tonight and it was nice.  Hung out with some of my favorite gay guys.  Loves it.  If you are bar-hopping in the Castro, check it out.
author: Cynthia B.

description: I do love this bar.  I haven't had any bad experiences with my drinks being made wrong, waiting more than 4 or 5 minutes on a busy busy night to have my drink in my hand, and I do love the outside patio.  I don't smoke but I do love the fresh air when the inside is so hot.  I don't think I've ever been inside for more than 10 minutes.  But I do love this place, the scene seems to be a very chill crowd of people
author: Joshua M.

description:
Ive only been here once, and had 2 drinks... I dont remember much after that.

Prior to that, I remember it looking a lot like a revamped Badlands (Everyone compares EVERY bar to Badlands), and thats not totally bad, or totally good, its just very....regularly typically gay. Part ultra lounge, part bar, part patio drinking. The usual.

What set this place apart was that it wasnt as crowded as other bars Ive been to, and those were on weekdays. So for me, someone who likes to have a drink, and socialize on a Monday night, its not too bad.

I give it 4 Stars for atmosphere, and drinks that made me forget the night, and its missing that final star, only because there was nothing extremely inspiring about it.
author: William D.

description:
This is rare---a gay bar where you can converse with your friends without increasing voice decibels, find a table to sit, and where guys are fully clothed! If this wasn't at The Castro, you wouldn't be able to tell that this is a gay bar. We came here for a breath of fresh air coming from Badlands and I was so relieved that I wasn't sweating like a pig here! The gay boys here looked very dapper, not as flamboyant and outrageous like Badlands. The best part of the night was seeing 2 men in their birthday suits outside of Toad Hall, balls and penises hanging out, hairy assholes, and lanky legs. I couldn't help but stare. No I'm not a pervert, but you don't see that everyday, only at The Castro! I guess it's legal to walk around naked at The Castro as long as you don't have an erection. So you exhibitionist boys, don't think or erotic, sexual thoughts or else you will get arrested!
One more thing, we didn't have to pay for cover charge! Up one star!
author: Jojo N.

description: As a first time visitor to San Fran, this club really presented itself with fresh drinks and a great atmos.  Suggestion do nor wear a hat or jacket here, you will loose it.
author: Giovanni H.

description: Drinks are good, and the music is good also. This one bartender was just rude for no reason. Not my first stop when I bar-hop.
author: Omar J.

description:
i celebrated the first part of my birthday night at TD along with about 13 of my closest friends, the bouncer let me in with my drivers license that expired that day (but i DID have my current passport on me as well)

my friends treated me to sapphire and tonics, and  were delicious and well served!!

LOVED that they DJ played some belanova!! 


only bad part of the night was getting one of my drinks stolen from a little latin boy, who does that?! ooh well i should've been taking more care of it!
author: denisse a.

description:
I'm so hoping this place finds it's groove, because there is a lot to like about it.  The decor is definitely a bit more upscale than your average Castro bar, but is not overdone.  The back patio is very well designed and my fav spot of the place (even though I don't smoke).  And like the owner's other bars the drinks are strong, reasonably priced, and the staff is attractive (without being clone-y), reasonably diverse, and ridiculously nice.  Admittedly I'm a bit biased towards the staff because three good friends work either here or across the street at the owner's other property - but they really are gold.

Now, since I actually do care about a place like this having success, I'm going to put on my marketing hat and talk about what seriously needs to be fixed to avoid failure.  I am not the first one that refers to this place in its current state as "Baby Badlands" or "Badlands' Waiting Room" - and that's, unfortunately, a recipe for failure.  Badlands is a unique success and I do not think it is capable of becoming a franchise for many reasons.  This place needs to find its own groove, its own regulars, and come into its own as completely independent from Badlands, or it will most definitely fail.  Here's what needs to be fixed (in order of priority):

1) Get good independent DJ's from across San Francisco spinning there on either regular or random nights, let them bring their own playlists and their own style, and just turn 'em loose and let 'em go.  On nights when you can't get a live DJ, get your DJs to make pre-mixed sessions to run through the night - don't play the same video tracks played over at Badlands.  Or heck - let your staff program a playlist on non-DJ nights.  Admittedly, it seems the owner has gotten part of this message - last Saturday the DJ was really moving with the crowd and it was quite good.  The hip-hop seemed a bit forced at the end, but, in general, it felt like the DJ was being let loose, which often doesn't happen at Badlands.

2) Take that damn dance floor OUT.  It is too small and looks absolutely ridiculous in that space.  This place seriously needs to be a lounge bar.  The dance floor makes it obvious there's an attempt to replicate Badlands - and that will be its undoing.

3) Turn the volume down on the music to about half of what it is now.  Again, there is a sore lack of a truly nice, upscale, friendly LOUNGE bar in the Castro.  The rest of San Francisco is full of these types of bars and they do very well - but they ain't gay.  Why can't WE have one, too???!!!

4) NO MORE MUSIC VIDEOS.  Use the video screens to play cool loungey visuals or visuals chosen by the DJ.  The best use of this I saw was on girls night at the Lookout on a Thursday - lots of cool old movies and foreign films (even some TV shows) playing in the background to go with the really eclectic music.  It created a totally cool and hip vibe - and so very different than Badlands or any other typical 'stro bar.

5) Take out the tables, put in banquettes, sofas, etc. along the walls.  Again, this place seriously needs to be an upscale lounge.  It has so much potential as this given the quality of the staff and the great space - and especially how miserably Trigger delivers on what "upscale" should mean in the 'stro.

6) Upgrade the alcohol behind the bar.  Get some higher end liquors.  Yes, you will need to diversify your stock and that will increase costs and you might have to increase drink costs to be a bit higher than Badlands, but you won't have to overprice them (like Trigger or Lookout) and you'll satisfy what a lounge crowd is going to want - to call their drinks.

I really don't want to see this place fail.  It has so much potential and I do love the staff and, in general, the crowd here.  But this place should not be only 3/4 full on a weekend because everyone would really prefer to be at Badlands.  This place needs to get its own devotees.  I hope to become one.  And if the owner reads this and wants to pick my marketing brain a bit further on how to make this place a bang up success, feel free to e-mail me :).
author: Chris P.

description: Toad Hall is the Badlands' more street smart kid brother.  Usually not as cramped, but they have the same cheap drink specials as Badlands and usually better music, playing a mix of old school R&B with occasional 80's dance ballads and pop hits.
author: Luke M.

description:
I used to like Pendulum a lot because it was the only predominantly African-American bar that played hip-hop music, and mostly because it was one of a kind. I was saddened when it closed, but hoped something just as fun would open up in its place. 

5 years and 3 awnings later Toad Hall emerges. This place is like any other bar, and sadly it's a clone of Badlands with the same kind of music, identical crowd and unfortunately bad service. The bartenders are incredibly inexperienced, but friendly. The music is popular but it all sounds the same. The decor is entirely like Badlands. Whatever happened to creativity. 

Honestly, I don't get the brouhaha about this place. I miss Pendulum!
author: Matin N.

description: Door guy, IMO of course, is rude and he seems to have something against women, maybe even women of color, idk. Everytime we go here hes rude and unpleasant which is somewhat understandable because hes a door guy but I didn't do anything to you so F off. Last time I went here he looked at me and my ID like 15 times and then made me take out another photo ID. Honestly my ID pic looks like me except I have SLIGHTLY shorter hair now. Inside its cool but Toad hall seems more male friendly and I'm not a gay guy so i don't like to stick around for too long. I always head to Qbar and The Cafe which is more my forte! Point is if you're a guy you'll probably love it here!
author: Patricia H.

description:
Badlands II kinda bombed...

its no different inside from anyother Bar

and least Q Bar went with some blue lighting as opposed to the typical amber/red lighting every other gay bar in the stro has.

440, Lookout, Badlands...BOC
author: Jared B.

description: FIRST & LAST time here.  Had not been here since it was The Pendulum, but wanted to see the  decor & get the feel of the new bar.  Ordered a Cosmo, but was given a Cape Cod.  Figured ok, no need to be fussy.  No one in the bar except for me & the bartender.  A "Hello, how are you doing?  Are you from the City? the Moon?  Timbuktu?  would go far in terms of getting to know one's customer.  Does the term "Repeat customer" mean anything?  Got nothing but the wrong drink.  The bartender was too busy reading his book to be the slightest bit sociable.  That's ok cause I'm a big boy.   I'm all grown up.  I didn't take it personally cause I don't need a babysitter either.  Finished one of two drinks & left.  No need to stay in a bar where one doesn't feel welcomed.
author: Arex O.

description:
I liked it - feel like it's staying true to itself.  I used to love the Bar on Castro (love, love, love) and then it moved to Church, and let's face it it's just not worth the walk.  I used to dance my ass off at Jet and now it's the sub par Trigger.  I used to have sweet dreams about Badlands (it was some of my most fondest memories) and now it's way too full, and with the wrong crowd.  Oh and not to mention the Cafe is still closed.

Needless to say, I really like Toad Hall.  The drinks were solid, the bartenders really really awesome, and the music was spot on.
author: Girls Named Cherise C.

description:
Good sized back patio with it's own bar, decent music, and moderately large space. While I personally don't always like the music there, my buddies often enjoy the pop BS that can often be found here and in Badlands. So, if you're wanting to hear some Britney, Beyonce and the like - this is your place. If you like house - it will likely annoy you.
I'm going to rant on this bar instead of all of the other bars in the area (such as Badlands, the Mix, etc.) because it's newer, and they should know better - take plastic!!! Using cash ALL of the time is just cumbersome, and it's proven that people will spend MORE on their card they they will while using cash! This is a newer facility, so they should def step it up! 
Overall, it's a great stop along bar-crawls, and they have a great happy hour for all of my fellow cheap ass drunks!
author: Dustin D.

description:
where to begin? after getting drunk at the LookOut and Q BAR, i wasn't even sure if i had a blast at Toad Hall.

all i remember was getting their infamous long island tea and seeing tons of mature men around me. yea, this place is full of them. i believe this is more of a sports bar, but not really? meh. definitely, not a dancing bar... you go to badlands or Q BAR for that.
author: Marc K.

description:
It's said that 2 stars is actually a good rating for a gay bar in the Castro.

Pros:
- Music:  We went on a Monday and the music was pretty good (with entertaining music videos).  Much better than the constant 80s music I always hear at Badlands.

Cons:
- Bathroom:  The bathroom is really gross (and I was here at 9pm on a Monday).  The floor was covered in unidentified liquid.  It seemed really unsanitary
- Drinks: Only two beers on tap- Stella and Bud Light.  I think there is room to expand the tap selection a little bit (especially if you have four taps already installed)
- Atmosphere:  This felt really skeevy.  PDA and drunken accosters abound.  I also find the random circular tables scattered around the bar awkward- would much prefer perimeter seating.  Also, why have an outdoor patio if it is 95% covered?

Overall Toad Hall is somewhere between a nice change of pace and a coup de grâce to 18th/Castro.
author: Jeff A.

description: I've seen some racist shit go down at Badlands...so I was a bit hesitant about Toad Hall but this place was really great! I went here with some girlfriends and we were looking for a place we could go dance with no cover. This place was a lot of fun...lots of dance music, lots of people with good energy! People are friendly here, and the women's bathroom is never crazy packed or a line! (YAYYYY).
author: Lauren S.

description: The drink specials were pretty good. It was buy one drink and get the second for $1 the night that we were there. The outside patio area was really nice and relaxing. The staff was really nice.
author: Emily D.

description: Came here with my gay and fabulous friends after the Joan Rivers show a few weeks ago.  Drinks were pretty strong, but music was not that good (definitely not for dancing) and the outside patio area was kinda dirty and dingy.  Hard to say, may have to come back on another night to see when it's really bumpin'
author: Maxine S.

description: This is a great place to grab a drink watch a few videos and chat with friends. We have been watching the Giants games all week long with my partner and half priced happy hour specials. the staff is friendly and the atmosphere is  fun fun fun!!
author: brian j.

description:
I was pleasantly surprised by Toad Hall when I went on the opening night for happy hour. I think it was a Thursday. They did a great job with the space they had, and an even better job on the out door patio. I only wish it would stay open at night. I hear music permits are what hold it up from being open at night.

It is a lot like Badlands in the sense that they have the same owner, but it does have it's own uniqueness. I am glad there is another new place open in Castro, and it shows progress and change for the community!
author: Ryan B.

description:
I'm kind of surprised how much I like this place. 

If Badlands and The Mix had a baby, it would be Toad Hall. Which isn't too surprising given that the owner of Badlands also owns Toad Hall, and the Mix's owner helped manage the renovations.

The inside has more of a sleek Badlands vibe with rainbow waterfalls behind the bar, cocktail tables and chairs sprinkled throughout, and a DJ booth and dance "area" that's really too small and limited to be used. The outdoors has wooden tables and stools, and really feels like The Mix with plastic surgery. It's covered by a retractable awning to make it usable even when it rains. Most of my friends smoke, so that's where we hang out -- but as a nonsmoker, it's one of the better ventilated areas for me to be able to hang out with my friends when they smoke.

Surprisingly, the cocktail hour goes relatively late (2 for 1 until 8:30), and the prices are pretty competitive (wells are around $4.50, depending what you get).

My issues with Badlands has always been that it's too dark and hard to see, and too many guys cop an attitude there that I don't see when I see them elsewhere. Fortunately, Toad Hall has escaped both of those drawbacks.

Overall, a nice hangout spot.
author: Kevin G.

description:
Toad Hall is a new Castro Bar.  A good 5 or 6 years ago The Pendulum closed.  The renovation span over several years and they even changed the look and the name about halfway through the construction.  The bar is pretty large and similar in style, look and tone to Badlands.  Toad Hall has a reasonably large back patio with an additional bar.  Even with lots of people smoking out there, it really didn't seem to get that smokey. 

Unfortunately their happy hour is only on well drinks (no call drinks discounted or 2 for 1).
author: Mike R.

description:
The fact of the owner using the name "Toad Hall" gets my personal vote for the most cynically crass thing that any bar in that neighborhood has done in a long time.

Naming aside, both times I've been here the place was pretty much dead, and the place was playing the same pop crap as most of the other bars around there. The layout and use of space suggest that they can't quite decide whether to be a lounge or a small dance club, kind of similar to the layout problems at Trigger, minus the awkward positioning of the bar in the middle of the room.
author: Boogee Z.

description:
I had just flew in to San Francisco (and boy were my arms tired!), and the friend I was staying with for the weekend suggested we all go to Toad Hall for Happy Hour. In all the times I've been to SF I've never been here, so for some inexplicable reason I was skeptical. 
I don't know why I was, but that skepticism left as soon as we walked in the door, oh and when I heard it was 2 4 1 Happy Hour until 830pm! The bar had a good sized crowd, some bumpin music and we were greeted quickly by the bartender. 
The drinks were like the men in the Castro, and the kind I like, strong and fruity, and really, two strong-ass Long Island Ice Teas for $5!?!?!?! I can't even get there her in the best dive bars of Phoenix!  I was with a couple of smokers, so the patio was nice. Lots of folks, 2 bartenders, big huge TVs showing some hot videos. 
Overall, good drinks and prices, nice scenery, I hear they have free Wi-Fi, so some could play "How many feet away am I?" on Grindr, and I'd go back again on my next San Francisco trip.
author: Anthony A.

description: Didn't spend much time at this bar but was really impressed that their was no cover compared to the other bars and club around this area for a Sat night. So that in itself is a huge plus. What ever happened to no covers on weekend?? Seems like economic times have hit other bars harder then this one!!
author: Michael H.

description:
Great time last night!  It was really busy but the Asian bartender with the tattoos got me my drink orders in less than a minute.  Plus, he was SUPER cute so ... definitely going back. :)

The outdoor patio is great - we need more places like this in the neighborhood.  You can get your dance on if you want, but if you want to hear yourself think, the patio is where it's at.

Fun night over all.
author: Alex L.

description: There's this one bartender here who calls drunk fag hags "stupid twats." I'm obsessed with him and subsequently I'm obsessed this bar.
author: Rebecca P.

description: I love Toad Hall! Great, friendly bartenders. I'm a HUGE fan of their happy hour. 2-for-1s til 9pm! I hit that up a lot. No dancefloor really, making it a perfect spot to meet up and kick things off with drinks, or re-fuel with drinks throughout your night/day out. Or just post up here and get your drank on whenever! I think it's been a great addition to the Castro.
author: Betsy W.

description:
had a great time with some friend's here.  music video tunes on the big screens, stiff drinks, and fun gay boys.

it's nice to snag a seat by the windows when it gets crowded and stuffy.
author: Sheri N.

description: This place is a great bar!  It's new and fresh, great mix of older people (by this i mean over 28, so no one really gets out of control.  Super friendly 'tenders.
author: Nick G.

description: This bar is great for two reasons: you can smoke outside and the Castro creeper factor is at a minimum. I don't have to worry about someone grabbing my ass while having a cig. Good times.
author: James G.

description: Happy hour here is like much of the Castro where they had a 2 for one till 9 which is awesome. Great stop with fun crowd, I go here with the girlfriend and some of the guys from work etc. Good times
author: Corvus C.

description: On of the few classy-er bars on the Castro.  Great ambiance and perfect, unique outdoor area in the back where you can hear each other speak and share a cigarette.
author: Andrew Christian C.

description: I really like this place!  I have never actually hung out inside, but I sure do love the porch!  There's always some decent music and entertaining music video going on, cheap drinks, a heated lamp and some fun cute boys everywhere!  This has become a great place to pre-game at, meet some cool people and then head out for some dancing.
author: Rebecca D.

description:
I just read Sachi "BWB - big white bitch" P's review about Toad Hall and can't disagree more.  I can't comment on her incident specifically (as I wasn't there to verify whether her ID does in fact look like her mom), but I can argue against her statement,"straight girls beware."  As a straight girl, I love going to this place (hello 2-4-1 happy hours gone crazy pants).  The bouncers are always so nice, the bartenders are flipping awesome and pour more-than-generous drinks, and the crowd is friendly.  I don't know what else you want in a bar.  Oh good music, and outdoor seating?  Hmm.... yeah.. 

Sorry that one girl's experience was awful, but a single person's experience certainly doesn't account for an entire demographic.  At any rate, I'd like to venture that maybe maybe the bouncer just thought someone was in need of an attitude adjustment.  Just sayin'
author: Nicole C.

description: One bar tender inside and two outside,  Never got a drink inside but had better luck outside.  Nice ambiance but lousy service.
author: Michelle P.

description: Okay, I have been here mainly on Sundays. Sundays are wall-to-wall people and they usually offer a beer bust for $8 all you can drink beer or well drinks 2 for 1 during certain times. The mood of the crowd is friendly and open. Mainly a guys bar. The bar tenders are friendly and fairly prompt. The outdoor area offers heating spots so you can still enjoy yourself even if there is a chill out. You can have a group or come alone and still have a blast.
author: Pierce B.

description: This place is nice to go to with friends to relax w/o the commotion of Badlands and other bars.  For those who smoke there is a back patio to relax in.  Now if they only cleaned the ceiling fans which look so nasty!  All in all this is a great place to hang out and have a better conversation than other bars.
author: Brian C.

description: Decent low-key place to go during happy hour (2 for 1 cocktails, M-F until 8:30PM) and have a conversation with friends in the patio, no shouting required...at least all the times I have ever been here, while the sun was still up.
author: Jenn C.

description: I don't know what to say about this place. On one hand, it's great to look at, and has a nice patio out back. The drinks were fine. Bartender was typical Castro, Abercrombie, Fierce wearing, easy on the eyes, rolled in a wife beater type of twink. The problem is that the place has no soul. I go to bars just to converse with others, as I am already commited (sometimes I think literally) and everyone was pleasant enough, but vacuous at best, lovely to look at, but where is that brain cell. This is like your dumb blond neighbor, gorgeous, but the train done left the building. I would certainly go back, just wouldn't make it a habit, as I doubt that I am the type of clientele that they are aiming for.
author: Anthony K.

description: Sucky music played too loud to boring patrons. I really WANT to love it since the renovation is so beautiful, but no.
author: Josh A.

description: Not a bad place to grab a drink.  I like the interior.  Also, it's a nice mix of people.  You don't just have the same stereotypes all together.  It's a mix (the way life should be).  I think the patio is nice, but the smoke doesn't ventilate well (why must everyone still smoke?).  Overall it's a great place.
author: Eric S.

description: I like this place, it's a great place to boy watch , and see new video's. I go with a group of friends I know and just chillax and have fun. Drinks are plenty .They have a patio so you can go smoke and have your cocktail at the same time. Folks do dance too!. Check it out no cover and its fun. The Musice is great!  Feels very 80's to me.
author: Susie S.

description: Went there for the first time Saturday night.  Was pleasantly surprised.  Less crowded than Badlands, generous drinks, and Lady Gaga music videos :-)  Would go there again.
author: Dan P.

description: This is where I saw Bebe Zahara Benet and she touched my friend's hand. Five stars.
author: Cathy T.

description: Last stop! Toad Hall, a hip and a hop away from 440 Club we are at Toad Hall. This is my 2nd time here. Again no straight boys so I thought hey at least I should get some good eye candy right? I remembered the bartender in the back patio was yummy! Hung out in the smoke filled patio then left after my water. Yes Water time! Toad hall is fun dancing spot with music videos playing in the background.
author: Karen T.

description:
Those cheap drink specials posted on their outside window might look attractive though you may need to pay with exact change to get them.  My partner and I were overcharged after being told the sign that brought us in  only applied to  a different day (despite not being marked as such).  We complained through the bars web site.  Our complaint was recognized in reply as valid with no effort to reimburse. We'll go elsewhere next time, you should too.
UPDATE:  After our yelp posting we received a 2nd email, this one sent by the bar manager offering us reimbursement and a free drink along with an apology and a promise for better "sign management" in the future.  One star changed to three for perceived sincerity;  better late than never.
author: David R.

description: Very nice bartenders, good drink prices, CLEAN bathroom. Their 2 for 1 specials, which my friend and I usually hit on a Saturday afternoon, keep us plenty "satisfied" if not staying longer than we intended. Steve, the bartender couldn't be friendlier. A refreshing change.  Even if they weren't running 2 for 1 we would drink here. Hot staff.
author: mark z.

description: Been here a couple times with my samesies! I love the fact that it's always been poppin' both times I went, and the drinks are way more affordable! Music is good, can't complain about the crowd. Although the 2nd time we went, there was this one couple that was showing WAY too much PDA...it's like they were giving us a freakin' show right in front of our face! The only thing I don't like about Toad Hall is that the dance floor is so small =(
author: Kristine C.

description: I enjoyed this bar....from what I remember...mind you, I was on a pub crawl and this was the fifth bar on the list.....
author: Blake J.

description: My favorite place to start the night! Toad Hall isn't the place to come for dancing, as I've never really seen much dancing going on despite the small dance floor area. It is however the place to get good drinks, especially during happy hour. Nice decor inside with generally pretty good music. The outside patio has its own well and is spacious and smoke-friendly, but the rainbow Christmas lights on the ceiling are tacky. My only complaint is it tends to get way too warm inside, and they often have the outdoor heaters on when they're not needed, so there's no escaping the warmth! All in all, take your happy hour over to Toad Hall first, you won't be disappointed.
author: Brian B.

description: Finally it is OPEN.  This place is new and fresh.  Something new to check out.  I like the lay out and the front bar back drop.  The patio is awesome.  I don't like where the coat check is though.   I also do not think the bar is big enough to have a dance floor and that D.J. booth has to go.  Maybe they should spruce up the patio area with some plants and do something with that back bar decor.
author: Roddster V.

description: This place is great - good people good music good drinks good bartenders and a damn good way to waste some time.
author: Jay M.

description:
It's been a long time coming and - despite not really wanting to - we actually love Toad Hall.  We've become happy-hour regulars, (not late-night clubbers), and really like the clean, comfortable design, the easy-on-the-eyes and friendly bar staff, the music and, most of all, the great rear patio.  

True, there is nothing particularly creative or unique about Toad Hall.  But, then again, so many of the Castro watering holes feel shabby and are filled with depressed drunks, these days, so I suppose it IS unique that the place is fresh and happy.

There are a few "pet peeves," I'm afraid.  We've been ordering the same drinks, several times a week, for several months.  They are almost ALWAYS out of our preferred fruit, (nothing fancy, just a lemon twist or, failing that, a lemon wedge), and often out of our preferred liquor, (again, nothing fancy, Sky, Bacardi).  You'd think someone would mention that this happens daily and that they would fix it.  (Business Hint:  If you're constantly running out of something, it probably means you're selling a lot.  Maybe you should stock a little more).

And, who ever heard of a bar that doesn't have coffee?  On these cold winter days, it would be so nice to have an Irish, or Kahlua Coffee but, while they have the liquors, they don't have the coffee.  (The bartender suggested I run down to Starbucks, once, and that they would add the liquor when I came back!).

Anyway, despite the pet peeves, we really enjoy the bar, staff (although it would be nice if they could remember what the regulars drink), and the crowd.  A perfect after-work stop off.
author: Sebastian T.

description: drink specials +madonna on the regular =love
author: Lauren V.

description: uh HH on saturdays?!? yes please! the deal was buy one get the second for $1...things definitely got a little cray cray since we were here to help celebrate a friend's going-away. bartenders were super nice. there's a nice patio area in the back. 2 bathrooms...it is a little weird that there is a stall and a urinal right outside of it. but it works.
author: Linda N.

description: I like the space. Kinda reminds me of Badlands crossed with Hunters in Palm Springs, with the patio of Mix thrown in at the back. So far, I've seen quite a varied crowd there. I think a lot of people are checking it out. On my three occasions there, there seem to be more guys in their thirties and forties than at Badlands. To me, that is a nice change. I hope the music changes though. I do like Badlands for music occasionally, but I'll go there for that. I hope this place can come in to it's own identity and not just an extension of Badlands.
author: Scott H.

description: Went here last night for the 4th, and it was pretty damn fun. Had good music, top 40 with music videos playing, really nice bartenders, good priced shots of tequila, the gays know how to get down. And for a straight single female like myself, this is a nice place to go to just dance and let loose with friends.
author: S. M.

description:
I have only been once, but I went on a nice night on Friday and it was nearly dead.  The drinks were good, not great.  The music was good, but three people were dancing - and thats it.

The good thing was the crowd was mixed.  It seemed like a great meeting place to start the night and get a few drinks (and possibly dance).  I would go again, just not rush back.
author: Alex C.

description: It's a little like Badlands, part 2, but less crowded and with less dance-able music. Still fun though, especially if you want to have a little breathing room while dancing.
author: J M.

description: Bad time.  Two jokers from "Alabama" tried to steal my wallet, then proceeded to tell one of the barbacks that I was hustling them, and I was ejected.  Yeah...bad experience.  Will stick to Badlands & other Castro bars.  WARNING: be weary of the two boys with southern drawls & keep your hands on your wallet/phones at all times.  :/
author: Karma K.

description:
Umm, badlands part 2? I realize its the same owner, but sheesh....how about a little variety!! This place is just like badlands except smaller, cleaner, and with a cute little patio out back. Someone else said that this place is like the badlands/mix offspring and I cant agree more!!
The +++'s: 
Drinks were super duper cheap! was here on a Thursday night and they had happy hour til 10pm (if theres one thing i like more than happy hour its happy hour that goes late!). Ordered a ketel and soda for myself and my friend....got 4 of them all for $13!! That's like the price of one at a bar in any other city! Kudos to Mr Toad for the cheap libations. 
Also, who doesn't love a bar with an outdoor patio?? I mean sure, the weather in SF may not be ideal for such a concept, but toad hall has heat lamps on they're patio for us to all huddle around. There's also a bar on the patio so you don't have to venture allllllll the way back inside for a cocktail ;) 
The music....again, think badlands. Lots of pop, dance and euro trash type stuff....twas fine.  
All in all, i will def return to toad hall. Its a nice (yet oh so very similar)alternative to the mess that is sadlands. Count me in!
author: Paddy B.

description: Fun place.  Loved the bartender that was there when I first walked in.  With all his activity he kept screaming WHOA!.  I thought he was high, but it was just his energy.  Great to watch.
author: Roger S.

description: First time in my life that a bartender actually scoffed at the tip that I left him.  I thought he was joking but he made it very clear it wasn't enough.  I know how to tip.  You have to be pretty full of yourself to insult the customers and know you can get away with it because there are lots of guys in line behind him with cash in their hands to feed your tip jar anyway.  A pox on this place!
author: Lars H.

description: Great for Happy hour a well decore for chatting. and the dancing is fun at night too. I heard about a back patio, Oh My!
author: Missy I.

description: Friendly, fun, stylish hangout - great patio, too. Drinks were strong, cool and tasty, just like all the cuties that work there. Great looking crowd, and no attitude to be found - how did that happen? I was there for birthday drinks with a great group of friends last week, everyone had an excellent time. Get there soon.
author: Steve C.

description: Great overflow bar when you want badlands, but don't want the crowd.  By far has the best smoking room with a bar included out of any place in the Castro.  Only good on the weekends, but had a great time there pride 2009.
author: John H.

description: Oh, 2 for 1 drinks on a Saturday afternoon = AMAZING!!  That's all that needs to be said to justify the rating :)
author: Olivia T.

description: Went there on a Sunday afternoon for a charity event - love day time drinking! The music was good, mostly top 40 and some throw back Lil Kim!  Cute bartender, 2 for 1 drinks, nice area outside but what no mirror in the bathroom!! Love it anyways!
author: Kan P.

description: What can one say about Toad Hall?  For starters, their patio is great, and you can always seem to find a friendly face there.  Secondly, the dance floor, albeit tiny, is fun (when you have the right partner of course).  And lastly the service.  At most bars in Castro you can always find a welcoming smile from many of the bartenders, however at this establishment I found one who is a cut above the rest!  I was out on a thursday evening, and after throwing back a couple Vodka Tonics (extra lime of course) I noticed (to my horror) a friend had threw up on herself, the working bartender, and the man next to her.  I, however, was not in this line of fire.  Imagine for a moment being thrown up on...... I would be a little peeved, however, the bartender working was a complete and total gentleman.  He helped my friend clean herself up as well as going the extra mile to make sure she was comfortable, and reassured her to not be embarrassed about said situation.  Anyways, I made sure to get this bartenders name, as well as to yelp him, because even after this whole debacle he's always had that smile, and that great genuine attitude.  I believe his name is Nathan, and not that i go to Castro too often, you can see him working here.  He always says hello, and makes marvelous drinks! He is a great asset to this place, and probably the main reason i go back! He's awesome, and and great! When you  see him, make sure to smile, and tip well  =)
author: Brendan D.

description: this place is just fun!  there is an indoor portion and patio outdoor portion.  like most places in castro, its tight on space.  but its gay, fabulous and fun!
author: tony p.

description: I'm very sorry to say that my experience of Toad Hall the second time round was extremely disappointing, at best. I returned because the first time I went, the music was so much fun to dance to, and I've been hard pressed to find good dance music that isn't entirely repetitive in San Francisco, save for live bands. This place is like Dr. Jekyl and Mr. Hyde! The bar staff was wonderful during serving hours, but as soon the staff began kicking us all out of there, everything changed. It was only 15 until 2, and without even waiting for a fight, the staff kicked immediately into nazi mode to get everyone out the door! I politely told the fat bouncer (yes, fat, not muscles) that I needed to use the toilette first, please, and he barked at me to hurry. I went inside, and this disgusting guy came inside, whacked out on god knows what, told me he was going to jack off, so I left and went into the other one. It was full, so after a moment, I went back to the first one to see if jack off had finished, but he was still in there. At this point, fat ass bouncer came to me to tell me to leave again, and standing next to me, he interrupted my calm explanation about the jack off guy with absolutely NO provocation on my part, NO movement on my part, and no touching on my part, by barking "Don't touch me!!" It was so bizarre! I overlooked it, and decided he was tripping out on something, and proceeded to finish my explanation of why I was still there, which was that I was waiting for jack off to finish. I was so unnerved by the harshness this fat bouncer exhibited toward me, so on the way out, I said in my defense, "I had no intention of ever touching you!"  to which he yelled something crass back at me, couldn't make it out, but I know it was hostile. Meanwhile, my friend had been literally physically forced outside the bar, even though he had no drink and hadn't drank alcohol all night - in fact, that was why they told him he had to leave! They said if he had a drink, he could stay! He was stunned, having been a barman/bar manager for several years in Europe, that this is how they treat the sober people who are responsible enough to drive and not wreak havoc on the streets or with innocent ladies in the toilette, such as my jack off guy, for that matter. He tried to keep an eye on me from the outside, so they saw this, and came by and shut the shade in his face! It was very obviously a hostile act. (Is this because he was straight and not into them all night? Can't help but wonder!) The music was ok if you like top 40 crap. But fat ass guy clearly has a deep seated anger toward females - no respect whatsoever. I don't care if this is a gay bar, per se, fatt ass needs to get with the times and remember what the rainbow flag originally intended before the gay community glommed onto its magnanimous meaning and claimed it their own - the multi colours stood for all orientations, all walks of Life, all ethnicities, all genders and identities thereby, to come together and Unite under one flag. It's natural that the gay community grasped onto this concept the quickest, being's how we have been so ostracised by the world at large, but its time to relinquish sole hold on that flag and share its True meaning once again. Being new to the bay area, I was shocked at such obvious display of masoginy in the gay community, since I had otherwise experienced most of San Fran as being really cool about mixed crowds. Especially this kind of treatment from a bouncer, with whom I have never, in my Life, experienced problems, let alone been bullied by males like this. Neither my Friend nor I were harmful to anyone in there. We minded our own business, made some friends, even, and had a good time being out, for the most part - until we had to deal with fat ass' childhood issues rearing their ugly head.  This guy really needs to sort out his mother issues - either that or get another job. They are looking for bouncers there, we noted. Huh, wonder why?
author: Thomas C.

description: i think Harvey Milk would rollover in his grave if he saw how lame this place is now...again had lots of potential to be something new and different...now its a mere afterthought for a possible happy hour place...Meh.
author: Sancho P.

description: Like the video screens.  Haven't really been too far inside, because it's been pretty crowded.  Strong drinks.
author: Christopher H.

description: Great place. Nice bartenders, Handsome design, cute, clean patio, and awesome happy hour- 2 for 1!
author: DarkNGay H.

description:
Arrived around 10pm on a Thursday night where the first bar was occupied wtih a big group ordering.  I moved to the next bar and the bartender walked over to tkae my order.  As soon as I was finished, he was abck in front of the large group, preparing to make 6 mixed drinks and 4 shots.
Another bartender asked I had been helped, when I told him what I had ordered, the first bartender started yelling at me that I had given him the order, not the new bartender!!  He was screaming at me!  When I told him that he was going to be awhile with the other group, he insisted he could multi-task and I underestimate him.  He then proceeded to scream at the new bartender.
When the beers arrived, the new bartender profusely apologized and I told him that it's obvious at Toad Hall that they are all about the customer experience (very sarcastically).  I asked to speak to the manager and he told me that the first bartender is the manager.

Sum it all up - the Asian-American guy at the first bar inside the front door is also the manager, so he's allowed to scream at customers and get away with it and scream at the staff and get away with it.  It was obvious he was trying to protect his tip, not his customer base.
author: Derek N.

description: We were having a good time and were told to be quiet by a fat ass bartender. I thought going to a bar was a place to release the tensions of the day. I think this bartender ruined the night for a lot of us. It's going to be awhile before going there again. We're very disappointed as it's the place where we like to meet friends. Lucky for us, we can decide where to meet and will look elsewhere for our next excursion where we can be "loud!"
author: George F.

description:
what's up with the castro?? why do the same owners keep opening up shitty bars? this might as well as be badlands II. nothing special. gross drinks, shitty music, etc etc.

enjoy!
author: brian t.

description: After the rude treatment across the street this place was GREAT. good music and very friendly bartenders. He even offered to make my drinks while I went to the atm, so they'd be ready when I returned. And I liked the mixed crowd, a wide age range with very little attitude. And out of such a huge crowd, I only saw one person falling down drunk! Everyone else was not just coherent, but friendly and fun! I'll go back again for sure.
author: g g.

description: ive gone to this bar once, and really enjoy myself. the staff was friendly, the drinks were cheap, and the others patrons were nice. no complaints.
author: Missy M.
